item.title: Security | Japan and the United Kingdom reaffirm cooperation
item.description: The Prime Minister of Japan, Sanae Takaichi, and her British counterpart, Keir Starmer, this Saturday reaffirmed cooperation in security matters on the sidelines of the G20 Leaders' Summit, which ended yesterday in South Africa. Takaichi and Starmer “agreed to continue to cooperate on security issues” and also “agreed to collaborate closely in the areas of economy and economic security”, said the Japanese Prime Minister's office yesterday, which reported on the results of a meeting between the two leaders in Johannesburg the day before. In the first meeting between Takaichi and his British counterpart since the governor took office last month, both leaders also reaffirmed their intention to work “closely” with the United States for a “free and open” Indo-Pacific. The statements come in the context of strong diplomatic tension between Tokyo and Beijing, since Takaichi stated in the Japanese Parliament that a military attack by China against Taiwan could justify the intervention of the Japanese Self-Defense Forces (Army) (see page 12). Beijing responded with harsh reprimands and economic reprisals, while demanding that Takaichi recant and advising its citizens not to travel to Japan, which led to hundreds of flight suspensions. Takaichi refused on Friday to retract his statements regarding Taiwan and maintained that this is the Japanese government's “consistent position”. At the same time, the minister reiterated her desire to maintain beneficial relations with China and launched a new call for dialogue. Tokyo expressed its availability for a meeting between Takaichi and Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang at the G20 bilateral meetings, as China had said last Monday that there is no planned meeting between the two leaders during the summit.

item.title: LAG | Miguel de Senna Fernandes calls for more focus on Macau
item.description: The president of the Association of Macanese, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, defended the importance of regional integration, but highlighted that Macau is going through a “delicate” moment and needs more attention from the Government. Senna Fernandes' position was taken in statements to Canal Macau. "Macau is integrated into the Greater Bay Area, nothing other than improvements are expected to accelerate the development of the Greater Bay Area. But, we cannot forget that we are in Macau. This is fundamental", began by saying the president of the association, regarding the Lines and Governing Action. “There is no citizen, no matter how noble, no matter how much he defends the Government, no matter how much he applauds the Government in this policy and Macau's contribution to development, there is no citizen who does not have Macau as a priority”, he added. In a context in which the recovery of tourism covers society in an unequal way, Miguel de Senna Fernandes asked for more attention to Macau, because it is going through a complicated period: “Despite the economic recovery numbers, we cannot forget that there is still a group of citizens to whom this does not reach”, he stressed. "We need to say the measures, and I'm not saying long-term, but medium-term, to improve the conditions, the future prospects of this layer of workers, of professionals in Macau. Don't just feed the dream of Hengqin, for example. There are people who like to stay in Macau and for them Macau is always the future", he highlighted.

item.title: PJ | Pedida maior cobertura de programa anti-burlas
item.description: O deputado Chan Lai Kei interpelou o Governo sobre a necessidade de reforçar e aumentar a cobertura do programa anti-burlas da Polícia Judiciária (PJ), tendo em conta os frequentes casos de burla que ocorrem associados a falsos funcionários da plataforma Taobao. Therefore, the deputy, with connections to the Fujian community, questioned whether analyzes using artificial intelligence (AI) could be introduced in this program so that alerts could be given to users whenever they find messages with a high risk of fraud. Furthermore, the deputy recalled that there is a face swap technique using AI, which leads elderly people to easily become victims of fraud, which is why he hopes that the PJ will use this anti-fraud program to publicize these types of cases to groups of potential victims of fraud. Na mesma interpelação, o deputado pergunta ainda como vai o Governo reforçar a cooperação com as regiões vizinhas no que toca à partilha de dados transfronteiriços, a fim de rastrear a origem e fluxo de capital envolvido em burlas.

item.title: Barra Slow Festival | Coffee and culture in Naval Workshops
item.description: It's called “Barra Slow Festival” and the first edition is scheduled for next weekend, between the 28th and 30th of November, with the aim of revitalizing the Barra area with activities linked to coffee culture, design and crafts. The public will be able to enjoy events at Naval Workshops nº 1 and nº2, as well as in the square located in the area This weekend, namely between Friday and Sunday, the first edition of the “Barra Slow Festival 2025” is taking place in Macau, an event that brings various activities linked to coffee, culture and art and aims to attract public attention to the Barra area, known for tourist sites such as the A-Má Temple. According to an official statement from the event, this is a debut in the territory of events such as “To Play Market × Tokyo Coffee Festival · Macau 2025” and the “Shanghai UNFOLD Art and Design Fair”, as well as initiatives such as “Coffee Rave”, “Macau Chill Collective” and an exhibition by well-known graphic designer Florian Lamm. All these events will be spread across the square in the Barra area and Oficinas Navais nº 1 and nº2, where cultural events usually take place. According to the same note, the “Barra Slow Festival” integrates “popular contemporary elements, such as coffee culture, creative design, visual exhibitions, limited artisanal products and music”, being a “cultural event with selected concepts”. The idea of ​​an event in which there is “human warmth” is defended, encouraging the public “to relax and live intensely, recovering the tranquility inherent to life”. In this way, “the Barra neighborhood was chosen [for this initiative], with tents set up inside and outside the historic buildings of the Naval Workshops”. It is therefore hoped that the general public “can enjoy a cup of coffee, stroll around the area and experience the historical depth of the Barra neighborhood”. From the outside to the inside Above all, the “Barra Slow Festival” brings to Macau events already known in Asia, such as the “Tokyo Coffee Festival”, organized by “To Play Market” and which brings together almost 50 famous coffee brands from Japan, the Greater Bay Area and Macau. “Just a few months ago, the Tokyo Coffee Festival made its debut in Hong Kong, attracting more than 30,000 participants, and both its artisanal coffee and coffee products were highly praised,” highlights the organization. At this premiere in Macau there will be special products for sale and limited editions. Another highlight of the lineup is the “UNFOLD” Art and Design Fair, organized in Shanghai by Shanghai BANANAFISH. This is an event with the curatorial concept of “unfold, read and present”, being a “communication platform that brings together lovers of culture and art, designers, creative workers and professionals from the creative industry”. What you can see in Barra, with “UNFOLD”, is a market with 100 stands of brands and design products from around the world, with “creative selections and limited artisanal products”, and ticket holders can also visit the special exhibition by designer Florian Lamm. Florian's works were selected for the Top 100 Posters in Germany, Austria and Switzerland, and won the Artist Award at the Brno Biennale, the oldest graphic design exhibition in the world. The “Macau Chill Collective” aims to “bring together the strength of local brands”, inviting “dozens of brands, from well-known cafe owners, creative artisans and creators”. During the festival, the exhibition “Ancient Memories: Impressions of the Shipyard – Historical Photographic Exhibition of the Barra District” will also be held in order to “deepen participants’ understanding of the history of the district”. O “Barra Slow Festival” tem entrada gratuita e decorre entre as 12h e as 20h, sendo necessário adquirir bilhetes para a Feira de Arte e Design UNFOLD, com um custo de 55 patacas em regime de pré-venda e 78 patacas nos dias do evento. There are also tickets for sale for some events related to coffee culture. Tickets have been on sale since November 2nd on the MacauTicket, Damai and Ctrip platforms. O evento é organizado pela Federação da Indústria e Comércio de Macau, Distrito Central e Sul, coorganizado pela BANANAFISH e TOPYS, e apoiado pelo Instituto de Desenvolvimento Económico e Tecnológico, pela Direcção dos Serviços de Turismo de Macau, pela União Geral das Associações de Bairro de Macau e outras entidades patrocinadoras.

item.title: Oceans | China, Portugal and Brazil create research laboratory
item.description: Among the institutions involved in the new project are the University of São Paulo (USP), the University of Macau (UM) and the Instituto Superior Técnico (IST) Academic institutions from China, Portugal and Brazil created a new project in Macau on Friday to collaborate on ocean research, including the impact of climate change and changes in marine currents. “We are going to deepen our knowledge of the oceans and have a more integrated vision, which will allow us to anticipate the future in a safer way”, the coordinator of the Robotics and Engineering Systems Laboratory told Lusa. The objective of the Oceanic Research Center between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries is “to collaborate and share data, resources and talents”, added José Santos-Victor. In addition to the laboratory associated with Instituto Superior Técnico, the new center includes the University of São Paulo (USP), the University of Macau (UM) and the Chinese state laboratory Laoshan Laboratory, based in Qingdao, in eastern China. “There are several research centers that do excellent work in these various areas”, defended Santos-Victor, giving as an example the research and prediction of the effects of climate change on the oceans. According to environmental groups, climate change is one of the greatest threats to the oceans, along with pollution and new technologies that open the door to deep-sea mining and more intensive fishing. A priority will be training, with plans for exchanges between researchers and master's or doctoral students between the center's various laboratories, highlighted the Portuguese academic. New master's degrees During the inauguration ceremony, UM's rector, Song Yonghua, promised the launch of joint master's degree programs between the universities that are part of the initiative. Ettore Apolonio de Barros, professor at USP, reminded Lusa that the Brazilian university created, in 2024, the USP-China Center, to “promote cooperation with Chinese universities”. The researcher highlighted the multidisciplinary nature of the center opened in Macau, as “one of the first initiatives” to bring together scientists and engineers to collaborate in the exploration and study of the oceans. The specialist in automated electromechanical systems recalled that the project is “an important development” of the Oceanic Scientific Research Alliance between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries. The alliance was also created in Macau, in 2022, by 19 universities from China and Portugal, Brazil, Angola and Mozambique, to launch joint research projects on the oceans. The vice-rector of UM, the Portuguese Rui Martins, told Lusa that the alliance was recently strengthened, with the entry of five more institutions, including the University of Hainan, in southern China. On the Portuguese-speaking side, the Technical University of the Atlantic (Cape Verde), the University of Coimbra, the Institute of Systems and Computer Engineering, Technology and Science (INESC TEC) and INESC P&D Brasil joined.

item.title: Tourism | New visitor record for October
item.description: The territory received around 33.1 million visitors in the first ten months, 14.1 percent more than in the same period last year. It is the second highest value ever, below pre-pandemic records Macau received 3.47 million visitors in October, 10.8 percent more than in the same period in 2024 and the highest figure ever for this month, it was announced. The number of tourists passing through the territory was the highest for any month of October since the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) began compiling monthly data, in 1998, still during the Portuguese administration. The region had already registered a historic high for September in the previous month: almost 3.8 million visitors, 9.8 percent more than in the same period in 2024. However, in October almost 61 percent of visitors (2.1 million) arrived on organized tours and spent less than a day in Macau. In 2024, the Central Government announced a series of measures to support the territory, such as increasing the tax exemption limit for goods for personal use purchased by visitors from China. At the same time, the Chinese authorities expanded the list of places with “individual visas” to visit Hong Kong and Macau to 10 more cities in China. Additionally, since January 1, residents of the neighboring city of Zhuhai can visit Macau once a week and stay for up to seven days. As a result, the overwhelming majority (89.8 percent) of tourists arriving in Macau in September came from mainland China or Hong Kong, while just over 353,000 were international visitors. The city received a total of around 33.1 million visitors in the first ten months, 14.1 percent more than in the same period in 2024 and the second highest figure ever for the start of a year. Below 2019 According to official data, the number of tourists passing through Macau was only surpassed between January and October 2019 – before the Covid-19 pandemic -, a period in which it registered more than 33.4 million visitors. On January 17, the director of Macau Tourism Services said she expected between 38 and 39 million visitors this year. In August, Maria Helena de Senna Fernandes set a target of more than three million international visitors in 2025. In the first ten months of the year, Macau received almost 2.97 million tourists from abroad, 14.9 percent more than in the same period in 2024. Citizens of Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain and Oman will no longer need a visa to enter the city from July 16th. Despite the increase in the number of tourists, the average consumption of each visitor in Macau, excluding casinos, fell by 9.5 percent in the first nine months of the year, compared to the same period in 2024. At the beginning of May, DSEC pointed to the “change in the consumption pattern of visitors” as one of the main reasons for the 1.3 percent drop in Macau's economy between January and March. It was the first time that the territory's Gross Domestic Product shrank, in year-on-year terms, since the end of 2022, when the region began to lift restrictions due to the covid-19 pandemic. Macau received 34.9 million visitors last year, 23.8 percent more than the previous year, but still far from the record, 39.4 million, set in 2019, before the pandemic.

item.title: Economy | EU expresses “concern about political issues”
item.description: Harvey Rouse, head of the European Union (EU) Delegation in Hong Kong and Macau, met with Macau's Secretary for Economy and Finance, Tai Kin Ip, to discuss investment by European companies in the diversification of Macau's economy The European Union (EU) declined to reveal whether Au Kam San, detained with Portuguese nationality, was mentioned in a meeting with Macau authorities, in which a European representative demonstrated “concern about political issues”. On Thursday, the head of the European Union (EU) Delegation in Hong Kong and Macau, Harvey Rouse, wrote on social media that he had met with Macau's Secretary for Economy and Finance, Tai Kin Ip. The two spoke about how European companies can support “the economic diversification” of Macau, which is highly dependent on tourism, and “the continued development” of the neighboring special economic zone of Hengqin (Mountain Island). “I also expressed concern about political issues,” added Briton Rouse. Asked by Lusa whether he had discussed the detention of former deputy Au Kam San with Anton Tai, the British diplomat did not respond. “We do not comment on the specific content of bilateral meetings,” the EU Delegation in Hong Kong and Macau told Lusa, in a written response. “In our meetings with the Macau authorities, we regularly raise concerns about political and legal changes in the MSAR [Special Administrative Region of Macau], in line with the EU Annual Report on Macau, including on individual cases,” the delegation added. On September 11, the European Commission warned that the “insistence on national security by the Macau government” is leading to “limiting the space for pluralistic voices from both politics and society”. Uncomfortable revisions In a report, the commission gave as an example the review of electoral laws for the leader of the Government and for the local parliament, to exclude candidates considered unpatriotic. On July 31, Macau police announced the arrest of pro-democracy activist Au Kam San, in the first case under the region's national security law, which came into force in 2009 and whose scope was expanded in 2023. On September 10, during a visit to Macau, Portuguese Prime Minister Luís Montenegro admitted that he did not speak about Au Kam San with the leader of the local government, Sam Hou Fai, and argued that the case requires “the necessary discretion” and “some modesty”. On October 21, the president of the Court of Final Instance of Macau, Song Man Lei, declared that the local justice system has an “indispensable duty” to judge “fairly, independently and professionally” national security cases, as well as “to ensure that all acts that offend the security of the State are punished in accordance with the law”. Recently, after the presentation of the Government Action Lines for 2026, Sam Hou Fai briefly addressed the detention of Au Kam San for the first time. “In August, we had the first case related to the national security law,” he said at a press conference, without mentioning the name of the activist. The accusation is not yet known and there is no information about who will defend the former deputy.

item.title: Culture | Tensions between China and Japan postpone meeting in Macau
item.description: A meeting of the “Cities of Culture of East Asia” was scheduled for today in Macau with ministers from China, South Korea and Japan. However, the initiative was canceled by Beijing, due to growing tension with Japan, following statements by the Japanese Prime Minister The meeting in Macau between the Ministers of Culture of China, Japan and the Republic of Korea, which was originally scheduled for today, was postponed, without a new date being set. The announcement was made on Thursday by Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Mao Ning, cited by Xinhua. According to information from the state agency, the Chinese spokesperson stated “that a Japanese leader openly made highly erroneous statements about Taiwan, which hurt the feelings of the Chinese people, challenged the post-World War II international order and undermined the basis and environment for cooperation between China, Japan and the Republic of Korea.” Mao Ning also said that the “Japanese leader’s” statements led “to a situation in which there are still no conditions to hold the meeting”. Although Xinhua does not identify the “Japanese leader”, the target is Sanae Takaichi, Prime Minister of Japan. The first woman to lead the Executive of the country of the rising sun stated, on November 7, in parliament, that an attack from the Interior on the Island of Taiwan would be seen in Japan as a situation that would “threaten the survival” of the country. In response, Xue Jian, consul general of the People's Republic of China in Osaka, wrote a post on the social network The publication was eventually deleted after a diplomatic protest from Japan. Rising tension In light of the diplomatic incident, the Government of China started to demand that Sanae Takaichi publicly retract the statements made in the Japanese parliament, which has been refused. Without Japanese backtracking, China issued a security alert on tourist travel, which was followed by the governments of Macau and Hong Kong. The Interior did not stop at the warning for tourists and forced airline companies to cancel flights to Japan, travel agencies to cancel hotel stays, blocked imports of Japanese seafood again, postponed the entry of Japanese films into the domestic market and issued a warning to students who intend to study in Japan. The meeting scheduled for today in Macau aimed to promote “exchange and mutual learning” between the three countries and was presented as a selection of the “Cities of Culture in East Asia”, which includes Macau. The Macao SAR Government portal dedicated to the event also stated that the meeting was “seen as a relevant achievement for humanity” and “a mark of cultural cooperation in East Asia”.

item.title: LAG | Government restricts the use of “Western” devices because they represent a “risk”
item.description: The Government is betting on Chinese electronic devices, to avoid risks associated with equipment coming from countries with a “hostile stance” towards China. Wong Sio Chak revealed that all public servants, including Portuguese, will take an oath of loyalty to China and Macao by the end of the year The Government revealed on Friday that the Public Administration is giving priority to Chinese electronic devices, because those coming from Western countries “with a hostile stance towards China” represent “a risk”. “Instructions have already been issued by the DSAFP [Directorate of Administration and Public Function Services], especially for critical infrastructures,” said the Macau Secretary for Administration and Justice. “We considered, as a priority, the use of devices from our country” in RAM’s government services and departments, highlighted Wong Sio Chak. The leader admitted to the Legislative Assembly that “there is a risk” in the supply of electronic telecommunications devices. “It is a very sensitive issue and one in which there is also a fragility”, said Wong, pointing the finger at “Western countries, especially some with a hostile stance towards China”. However, the secretary highlighted, during the presentation of the Lines of Government Action for 2026 in the area of ​​Administration and Justice, that the limitations only apply to the public administration of Macau. "We have an open market and we will not restrict the private sector to use foreign devices. Entities and the private sector have the freedom to choose these devices", explained Wong. On October 19, the Central Government accused the United States of carrying out a cyber-attack against the National Time Service Center (NTSC), responsible for maintaining the accuracy of the country's official time. The Chinese Ministry of State Security said the “systematic and long-planned” attack began in 2022, through a vulnerability in the SMS (short message) service of a “foreign brand” of mobile phones. The vulnerability made it possible to “covertly attack and gain control of the cell phones of several NTSC employees and steal confidential data stored on them”, said the ministry. Faithful and loyal Outro dos pontos de destaque da apresentação de Wong Sio Chak prendeu-se com o juramento de lealdade à China e à RAEM que todos os funcionários públicos, incluindo os de nacionalidade portuguesa, terão de prestar até ao fim do ano. O juramento faz parte de uma revisão dos estatutos do pessoal de direcção e chefia e dos trabalhadores da Administração Pública, que entrou em vigor a 1 de Novembro. The two revised laws determine that workers already in office have 90 days to take the oath, with refusal automatically implying the annulment of the appointment to the position or dismissal. But the secretary for Administration and Justice said he believes the process will be completed sooner and that “all public service workers will take the oath by the end of this year”. Wong Sio Chak, who took office on October 16, defended during the presentation of the Governing Action Lines for 2026 that the review “improved the management and accountability regime of management and leadership staff”. On November 1st, 264 directors of public entities and services took an oath in a ceremony, declaring that “they will dedicate themselves with all loyalty to the Macau Special Administrative Region [SAR] of the People's Republic of China”. In a speech given during the ceremony, the Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, asked civil service leaders to “firmly safeguard the full governance power of the Chinese Central Government”. In December 2024, the Legislative Assembly approved, unanimously and without any debate, the law that provides that public servants in Macau can be dismissed if they carry out “acts contrary” to their oath. A month earlier, when presenting the proposal, the then Executive Council spokesman, André Cheong, warned that public servants could be fired due to private conversations or comments published on social media. The oath will be mandatory for all public officials, including Portuguese ones, but it can be taken in Portuguese, one of Macau's two official languages, along with Chinese. According to the most recent Public Administration Human Resources Report, in 2023 the region had 34,311 public employees. The document does not mention how many have Portuguese nationality, only mentioning that 257 were born in Portugal. The two proposals also oblige public servants to take the oath in a “sincere and solemn” manner. The sincerity of the oath will be assessed by the hierarchical superior and any dismissal may be appealed to the courts. Every head The Government wants to launch, at the beginning of 2026, negotiations with Portugal on an agreement for the reciprocal recognition of civil and commercial judgments. Macau's Secretary for Administration and Justice, Wong Sio Chak, said that he intends to “strengthen judicial cooperation abroad and further expand legal exchange”. According to the LAG report, Macau wants, from the first quarter of 2026, to start negotiating an “agreement on the reciprocal confirmation and enforcement of judicial decisions in civil and commercial matters” with Portugal. However, the document does not mention any date for the conclusion of negotiations and the eventual signing of a final agreement. Macau and Portugal signed an agreement in 2019 regarding the surrender of fugitive offenders, whose criminal legality was called into question by the Portuguese Bar Association. The protocol is not in force, as it was not voted on in the Assembly of the Republic. The Macau LAG report also reveals plans to conclude, by the end of 2026, three agreements with Angola for the transfer of convicted people, the delivery of fugitive offenders and mutual legal assistance in criminal cases. These three agreements with Angola have been mentioned in the Macau LAG since November 2023, and that report pointed to the end of 2024 as a target for concluding the negotiations. Angola and mainland China signed an extradition treaty in 2006, which was only approved by the Angolan Parliament in 2011, and was ratified by the Government of Luanda two years later. During the discussion in the Angolan Parliament, the then Angolan deputy minister of Justice, João Monteiro, defended the importance of the agreement due to the large migratory movement between the two countries. At the time, authorities estimated that close to 50,000 Chinese lived in Angola, working mainly in construction, in reconstruction projects financed largely by loans granted by China. João Monteiro guaranteed that the two States agreed that extradition requests cannot include crimes of a political or military nature. Macau Simplex Wong Sio Chak reiterated to the deputies an old promise from the Administration and Justice department: administrative simplification. The government priority will aim to speed up processes and licenses, for example, for commercial establishments. In response to a question from Deputy Si Ka Lon, the Secretary for Administration and Justice said that, “as long as there are no major works”, a food and beverage establishment can obtain a license to operate in two days, upon presentation of all the required documents. The government official stressed that behind the flexibility of the administration machine are the concepts of “simplifying, decentralizing and optimizing”. Get to work The Secretary for Administration and Justice stated in the Legislative Assembly that the Government will continue efforts to implement the quota system for Public Service workers and reorganize some careers, eliminating those that are outdated and promoting mobility. Wong Sio Chak highlighted that since the launch of the quota management system in the Administration, in 2020, the number of public servants has increased, and that before changing the rules for progression or access between careers in the administrative machinery, the Government will listen to workers.

item.title: Coloane | “Connections Music.Movement.Nature” this weekend at Urban Farm
item.description: After being postponed due to super typhoon Ragasa, the “Connections – Music.Movement.Nature” festival takes place this weekend in the town of Coloane. Live music, crafts, workshops, dance and various types of activities for families will mark two days of communion at the Urban Farm space “Connections – Music.Movement.Nature” is the result of a community impulse of belonging and sharing of a family bigger than blood and genes, born in the antipodes of a city immersed in materialism and commercialism of the concerts of various types of regional pop that form part of the city's cultural agenda. After two editions in 2018 and 2019, and the postponement due to super typhoon Ragasa, the festival is back this weekend, this time at the Urban Farm space in the town of Coloane. Built by the community, for the community, this year's “Connections” has a lineup filled with 30 workshops from the most varied areas, 20 DJ performances and performances by Beto Ritchie, Lobo and Náv, an area for food, drinks and crafts by local creators and multiple activities for families. “Those responsible, who see themselves as ‘a collective creation that combines a conscious way of life with unique experiences’, intend through this initiative to provide ‘Family Activities, Lectures and Workshops, Exploration of Well-Being and Artistic Expression’”, indicates the organization in a statement. After the events held in 2018 and 2019 in the Ká-Hó Dam area, this year the party moves to a new, larger space, which will allow various activities to take place spread across seven different areas: the “Village”, a picturesque area that resembles a traditional Chinese village, with wooden houses in an oriental garden, will be the area for meals and drinks and the sale of handicrafts. Larry’s Place, Concept H, Lotus Cocktails, Cakes By Rose & Muse, Juk and Happy Stand are responsible for the food and drinks. In the “Village” there will be 10 stands selling crafts from local creators (Dreama, Cordelia Handmade, Zarja’s Selections, CeraGigi, Dollfie, Wickd Candle Studio, White Lodge Dreamland, Love and Light Handmade Studio, Gems Awakening, Free Spirit Home and the Rui Carreiro Barbeiro stand. Inhale, exhale Next door, the “Gypsy Camp”, an area with cushions and resting places, will allow musical exploration with musical instruments such as the asalato, participating in a drum circle, a singing workshop, or attending a handpan concert with the duo Nàv, who curates the area. Nearby, in a Mongolian tent (yurte), there will be a lecture on spiritual themes and individual tarot and soul reading sessions. Activities for families will take place in the “Family Tent”, offering Meditation for Families sessions, Mandala Dot Painting, Crochet, Circles of Life Painting and Construction of Animal Masks on cardboard. In the “family tent” Associação Sílaba will provide moments of interactive reading, the launch of “CaixaPiz” and activities for the little ones. Taking your feet off the ground, the “Treetop” area, a mezzanine built in the top of a tree, was chosen for all body exploration activities and more serene moments of meditation and relaxation. With activities taking place from morning to dusk, the “Treetop” will also host Brazilian Dance and Conscious Dance sessions, as well as Yoga, Gyrokinesis and CoreNature, a fusion of Pilates and Animal Flow. Sound Bath sessions and meditations at sunset and connection to nature are also planned. Enchanted forest At the bottom of the Urban Farm property, in the “Concrete” area, graffiti and urban art sessions are scheduled with the collective of local artists Outloud International Street Art Festival. Finally, in “Woods”, in a clearing in a small forest, there is an open-air electronic music and dance space, which will feature performances by several local and regional DJs. The musical offering will also be present in the “Village” area, with a more organic, lounge selection, focused on world music, as well as a live performance by Beto Ritchie tomorrow at 3pm and Lobo on Sunday at 6pm. Participants are advised to bring warm clothing, insect repellent, hats, sunscreen, towel, flashlight and portable ashtray. The event organizers announced on social media that entrance donations, which are still on sale, cost between 180 and 280 patacas for tickets for one or both days of the event, and at the door they will cost between 200 and 300 patacas.

item.title: Vietnam | At least 90 dead in one week due to torrential rain
item.description: The death toll in Vietnam in a week of torrential rains affecting the country rose to 90 yesterday, compared to 55 fatalities recorded the day before, while 12 people remain missing, authorities reported. Floods and landslides caused by intense and prolonged rains are affecting provinces in the center and south of the country, with Dak Lak and Khanh Hoa being the hardest hit, with around fifty deaths, according to data released by the Vietnamese Ministry of Agriculture and Environment. After days of isolation, authorities managed to distribute aid – food, supplies and clothing, among others – in the most affected and remote areas of Dak Lak, which remained without electricity, telephone signal or drinking water for days and whose inhabitants continue to use canoes, boats and surfboards to travel, official media reports. Images published by the Vietnamese press show houses completely submerged, as well as streets with water accumulated at the height of citizens' waists. The Prime Minister of Vietnam, Pham Minh Chinh, met via videoconference with the governments of several of the affected provinces from South Africa, where he is participating as a guest at the G20 Leaders' Summit, which ended yesterday in Johannesburg. The damage caused by the storm is estimated at around nine billion dongs (around 297 million euros), according to official assessments. The Vietnamese government will distribute 1.1 billion dongs (around 36.3 million euros) in support for the recovery of the provinces of Khanh Hoa, Dak Lak, Lam Dong and Gia Lai. Although the rains have eased since Friday, precipitation persists in several parts of the southern half of Vietnam, indicates the Zoom.earth platform, while search and rescue work continues.

item.title: Real Estate | Quarterly price increase by 7.7 percent
item.description: Data from the Statistics and Census Services Directorate (DSEC) shows that average house prices, per square meter of useful area, increased by 7.7 percent in the third quarter of this year compared to the previous one. In the Macau peninsula alone this increase was 12.6 percent, recording an average price of 74,590 patacas, “mainly due to new housing complexes being put up for sale in the reference quarter”, highlights DSEC. On the islands, the 4 percent increase in Coloane stands out, with the average price of autonomous housing units standing at 87,093 patacas, while in Taipa prices fell 4.6 percent, to around 70,110 patacas. The average price of autonomous housing units in constructed buildings stood at MOP65,897, down 3.2 percent quarter-on-quarter. DSEC also reveals that in the third quarter of this year, based on the stamp tax charged, 1,411 autonomous units and parking spaces were transacted for a value of 6.26 billion patacas. The average price per square meter of useful area of ​​autonomous housing units, in global terms, stood at 74,190 patacas.

item.title: Paulo Maia and Carmo
item.description: Zhuangzi, in the 4th century BC. C., understood time as a continuum in transformation that should not be contradicted but rather enjoyed in a “happy loitering”, xiaoyao you, flowing with it and to prove this he never stopped observing the mutations in the world of nature. The literate fans of the brush arts who read him did not fail to witness this incessant gaze. In the Ming dynasty, for example, one of the ways of expressing this attitude, calling on the viewer's involvement, can be seen in paintings such as the ingenious scroll of the Four Seasons (Sishi shanshui, horizontal scroll, ink and color on silk, 35.1 x 569.9 cm, by unknown author, at the Metmuseum) in which when rolled out from right to left, the painting successively reveals recognizable scenes that distinguish the seasons. The Japanese painter Sesshu Toyo (1420-1506), who spent two years learning about Ming dynasty painting, interpreted the theme of the changing seasons more than once and admirably in four vertical scrolls (ink and color on silk, 149.5 x 75.6 cm, at the Tokyo National Museum). Painted in the refined style then much admired by the masters of the ancient Song dynasty, Ma Yuan and Xia Gui, everything about them has the flavor of nostalgia. In the first, Primavera for example, shows the recognizable figure of a poet sitting backwards on a mule as he leaves a friend's house. Since the beginning of the dynasty, painters treated the grandeur of the landscape, accentuating what is particular to each season of the year, reviving this style called «Ma-Xia school». Others, at that time, displayed the passage of the seasons in a different way, focusing on meticulous figures of animals and plants that are the distinct material of each season. A member of a family of painters linked to the court, of whom few paintings are known today, in one of them expressively depicted Spring, when perhaps a new beginning is most felt. Yin Hong (c.1430-c.1500) in the large vertical scroll Encounter of Birds Under a Willow Tree in Spring (Chunliu juqi, ink and color on silk, 240 x 195.5 cm. at the Cleveland Museum of Art) shows, in detail, on the bank of a river under a willow tree and around a large gongshi, "stone of literati", a variety of flowers and birds, where they stand out for their size and exuberance a couple of peacocks. The peahen, in front, appears to be pushing a pugong ying dandelion, a sign of determination and good luck, just as the willow is of new beginnings, rebirth and fertility. And with the abundant water in the river, they are all appropriate figures to represent Spring. Anyone who knew how to interpret the scene could let themselves be lulled and, flowing, say like the poet Zhu Yunming (1461-1527): «If there are flowers and there is wine to celebrate, singing,/ How good it is to be a writer and inhabit the precious abundance of time!»

item.title: Today Macau
item.description: The Prime Minister of Japan, Sanae Takaichi, and her British counterpart, Keir Starmer, this Saturday reaffirmed cooperation in security matters on the sidelines of the G20 Leaders' Summit, which ended yesterday in South Africa. Takaichi and Starmer “agreed to continue to cooperate on security issues” and also “agreed to collaborate closely in the areas of economy and economic security”, said the Japanese Prime Minister's office yesterday, which reported on the results of a meeting between the two leaders in Johannesburg the day before. In the first meeting between Takaichi and his British counterpart since the governor took office last month, both leaders also reaffirmed their intention to work “closely” with the United States for a “free and open” Indo-Pacific. The statements come in the context of strong diplomatic tension between Tokyo and Beijing, since Takaichi stated in the Japanese Parliament that a military attack by China against Taiwan could justify the intervention of the Japanese Self-Defense Forces (Army) (see page 12). Beijing responded with harsh reprimands and economic reprisals, while demanding that Takaichi recant and advising its citizens not to travel to Japan, which led to hundreds of flight suspensions. Takaichi refused on Friday to retract his statements regarding Taiwan and maintained that this is the Japanese government's “consistent position”. At the same time, the minister reiterated her desire to maintain beneficial relations with China and launched a new call for dialogue. Tokyo expressed its availability for a meeting between Takaichi and Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang at the G20 bilateral meetings, as China had said last Monday that there is no planned meeting between the two leaders during the summit.

item.title: José Simões Morais
item.description: In Macau, most commercial establishments have the image of Kuan Tai (Guan Di in Mandarin), who appears with a strong body, red face, long black beard and dressed as a military officer, holding a spear in his right hand. As a person, he is known as Guan Yu and is related to the fall of the Han dynasty and the struggles to establish the Shu kingdom, in the period that preceded the Three Kingdoms. With the name Chang Sheng (长生), he was born in Xiezhou (today Yuncheng, Shanxi province), on the 24th day of the sixth lunar month in the 60s of the 2nd century. As an episode from his youth, it is said that one day a nobleman forcibly wanted to possess a girl and Guan Yu, outraged, killed him. Pursued by the authorities, he had to flee and according to legend, in order not to be recognized, Guanyin (known in Macau as Kun Iam) changed the color of his face to red. Another story says that a rural owner with a lot of power, in order to force everyone to buy water from him, polluted the other sources in the region. Saturated with such infamy, Guan Yu one day killed him and had to flee the city. During this flight, to cross the border (guan), he took the name Guan Yu. In the late Eastern Han dynasty (25-220), the decadent court in Luoyang was dominated by eunuchs and generals. Guan Yu was wandering as a street vendor in Zhuo Municipality (now Hebei Province) when he met Liu Bei and Zhang Fei. The three swore an oath in the Peach Garden to become brothers in arms, with Guan Yu and Zhang Fei vowing to help Liu Bei, linked to the royal house of Han, in his armed uprising to establish the Shu-Han kingdom. At that time there were two other different factions that divided the country and thus in the North, the Wei army led by Cao Cao dominated, in the East and South the Wu forces and in the West, the Shu. There were constant battles between them. Guan Yu, an avid reader of the Classic “Spring-Autumn Annals” (Chunqiu jing) who always accompanied him, had commanded the Shu garrison in Jingzhou for 10 years. In the year 219/220, while engaged in a battle outside the wall against the Wei forces, he was caught in a surprise attack by the Wu army, which was more or less allied with the Shu. The Wu conquered the city and killed Guan Yu, cutting off his head and, as a proof of friendship, handing it over to Cao Cao. Halfway there they learned that the Wei had made a peace agreement with the Shu and so the head was abandoned near Luoyang. The process of his deification was long. Although he was only God of War during the Ming period, when in 1578 Emperor Wan Li gave him the title of Emperor Guan (Guan Di), already in the Sui dynasty he had a temple dedicated to him in the place where he was buried, with the titles being given by all the following dynasties. During his life, Guan Yu had the position of Military Officer (Hou). In the Song dynasty he took the place of King (Wang). Due to his loyalty, honesty, piety, benevolence, sense of justice and courage, he became very popular due to the book San Guo Yan Yi, written at the beginning of the Ming dynasty. In this dynasty he was promoted to Emperor (Di) and then, in 1614, to Sage (Sheng) or Military Saint (Wu Di). As a Being so perfect, all professions want him as their patron and thus he is venerated as the God of War, Literature, Wealth and patron of Martial Arts. In Macau, Guan Di is known as Kuan Tai and the Sam Kai Wui Kun temple, located on Rua Sul of the S. Domingos market, is dedicated to him. There, the image of the God is entirely golden, with no objects in his hands and is accompanied on his left by Chau Chong and on the other side by Kuan Peng. His birthday falls on the 24th of the sixth lunar month, although no festivities are officially held in his honor. 灶神 Zao Shen – the god of the Stove The god of the Stove, known in Macau as Tchôu-Sân (in Mandarin Zao Shen), is the most important of the domestic deities and twice a month (during the New Moon and the Full Moon) he received offerings, despite his birthday only being celebrated on the third day of the eighth Moon. However, the most important ceremonies performed to this god are those that occur before the week-long journey, when the god leaves home and goes to Heaven to perform the annual report to the Jade Emperor about the family of the residence where he is placed. And that is why this god, also known as the god of the Kitchen, as for simplification he came to be called the god of the Kitchen Chimney, has great power over the lives of the people who form the household. It is in the last week of the lunar year that he ascends to Heaven to meet with the Jade Emperor, where he reports to him the events that took place in the room in his charge, returning on the first day of the year, where he is placed again in the kitchen, behind the stove. On the eve of the trip, on the twenty-third day of the last lunar month, the inhabitants of the house offer sacrifices to this deity, filling him with sweets so that he only tells good things to the Jade Emperor. In a ceremony performed only by men, the god of Stove leaves transported on a horse and to make the journey easy and pleasant, one of the male beings in the house takes a candle and burns the image of the god so that it can more easily ascend through smoke to Heaven. Before being named by the Jade Emperor as God of the Stove, or of the Kitchen, he was a husband who, having spent all his money gambling and selling his wife, years later, while begging on the streets, arrived at his former wife's house. She, recognizing him and taking pity on him, takes him to the kitchen where she gives him something to eat. But her current husband arrives and so she doesn't see him, she hides him in the fireplace. When the maid lights the fire, so as not to compromise the charitable woman, she stays there. The Jade Emperor, seeing his sacrifice, named him the god of the Stove, also known as the god of the Kitchen, or the god of the Home. There are other versions of both how the man lost the money and how his ex-wife supported him. She, without being recognized by her ex-husband, gave him some cakes and placed a coin in each one. The man, on the way, met another beggar, who, upon seeing the bag with cakes, asked him for one. He discovered the coin in the middle of the cake and, realizing that the other didn't know about the filling, proposed keeping them all, which he managed in exchange for a small amount. When he later found out what he had done, realizing his bad luck, he decided to commit suicide. The Jade Emperor, seeing his kindness, named him god of the Kitchen. The celebration of this deity's journey to Heaven began in summer, but during the Han dynasty it moved to winter and during the Ming dynasty it was celebrated by the people on the 24th, with sacrifices taking place the day before. Zao Shen is represented in an image containing only his figure, or associated with his consort, or even just characters, which is placed on the first day of the lunar year in the kitchen behind the stove.

item.title: Ana Cristina Alves
item.description: Por Ana Cristina Alves – Investigadora Auxiliar e Coordenadora do Serviço Educativo do Centro Científico e Cultural The image that the Portuguese have of themselves as a whole collective differs internally and externally, according to the thinkers and their ways of being in life, which in turn depend on broader cultural frameworks, their own collectivities. It is not expected that a Frenchman's view of the Portuguese and Portugal will be similar to that of a Chinese person, much less that of a Portuguese person, because their perspectives are conditioned by their historical-cultural development, which will define a specific civilizational stance for each thinker and their personal and collective life history. Furthermore, a foreigner's view of Portugal will always be more distant, for better or for worse, than a Portuguese person's close and committed view to the deepest roots of his being, even if he seeks to be as impartial as possible, as is the case of Miguel Torga, a writer and thinker who loved his country very much, but always in the middle, without letting himself be carried away by romantic and nationalist feelings, for example of Teixeira de Pascoes in The Art of Being Portuguese. Start with external views, those that reach us from beyond the Portuguese sea. Start with the very recent text Astérix na Lusitânia from October 2025 by Fabcaro with drawings by Didier Conrad, impeccably translated into Portuguese by Maria José Pereira and Paula Caetano. The compatriots, the “pá” people, who oscillate in the book between slang and the lyrical features of Portuguese fado, in the best that Amália has to offer, are presented in a critical and ironic way, sometimes scathing, in a tone coming from the French comic and rationalist school, which says what it thinks, because that is how it exists without worrying about the consequences that its open, frontal and critical thinking may have on the Portuguese people who will read these lines in band. drawn, many of them truly comical, but which certainly reach the emotional and nervous chords of the great heroes of the Lusitanian sea. Those in a better mood will take advantage of the pretext to laugh at themselves, while the more serious and sullen will have some difficulty digesting the comic strip, whose main feature is playing around the Portuguese sea, but gastronomically. The Portuguese stand out in the work for their taste for fish and fish sauces, being monotonously excellent in the thousand and one ways of preparing cod, which leads, obviously, to the despair of the illustrious Gallic Obélix, who finds himself surrounded by cod and fish sauce (garum) everywhere. Astérix and Obélix come on a mission to Portugal to help free Malmevês, a Portuguese man sentenced to prison for allegedly trying to poison Caesar with garum. They were called by a Portuguese character, whose name is highly revealing, Tristês. Meanwhile, Malmevês has a daughter, with another symptomatic name, Saudade, with whom Obeléx falls in love. The Lusitanians are left with sadness, longing and melancholy and are not indebted to their beauty, and it is with great regret that the Gauls will have to disguise themselves as Lusitanians to save Malmevês from prison, with the successful mission aided by Gallic intelligence that unmasks the real poisoner and his accomplice. Although the Portuguese are not presented as beautiful, intelligent, and some have little ethics, because they betrayed the hero of heroes, Viriato, their most positive aspects include interesting cuisine, with the exception of cod and fish sauce, but which includes pastel de nata and good wine, even green wine. Cuisine is undoubtedly the highlight of the narrative, from all perspectives, even that of the Discoveries, which are reduced and condensed in a reference to Vasco da Gama's Tasco “Oh Man, in Vasco da Gama's Tasco you discover new worlds” (Fabcaro, 2025, 36). The fact that the Portuguese love fado so much makes the atmosphere very sad for Gallic ears, who weave interesting philosophical considerations throughout the text about it, as it is considered to take away soul strength from Portuguese soldiers and people, who in the heat of the battle are appeased by the doleful and sad song that makes the warriors like this: “I suddenly became so melancholic” (Fabcaro, 2025, 28) or “after all, what do we spend our lives chasing after?” (Ibidem). In short, from this comic we take a look at our collective portrait, a sad and melancholic people, very marked by long years of repression, in which the revolutionaries find themselves in jail, like the one who shouts from behind bars "oh man, listen carefully, damned Romans! The united people will never be defeated." (Fabcaro, 2025, 33). Distinguem-se na Lusitânia umas verdadeiras mulheres de armas como a Gama, quando se diz, “seria impossível levar a missão a bom porto sem a ajuda da Gama” ( Fabcaro, 2025, 47). Por fim, os heróis gauleses partem rumo à Gália, retendo uma outra característica que costuma ser realçada em relação aos portugueses, a suavidade no relacionamento: “Ah estes lusitanos! São tão afáveis no trato…custa ter de partir, não é?” (Fabcaro, 2025, 48). Não se pode generalizar a imagem filosófica cómica desta banda desenhada a todos os franceses, mas o que fica para alguns é que a ilustre e antiga história portuguesa se resume bem a um notável heroísmo gastronómico, representado por uma mulher forte, a Gama, à frente do Tasco Vasco da Gama e enquanto ela estiver ao leme novos mundos de sabor serão sempre descobertos. Do ponto de vista gaulês é dispensável tanta melancolia e tristeza, mas salva-se no meio deste “estranho modo de ser” a afabilidade que deixa saudades da terra e vontade de regressar. Due to the characteristics of the Chinese mentality, shaped by centuries of Confucian harmony, one cannot expect the same type of open, free, critical record from a Chinese thinker. On the contrary, the descriptions will be carefully chosen so as not to offend other people's sensibilities, as is the case in the work of the thinker and historian Wu Zhiliang (吴志良), Crónicas de Portugal 葡萄牙印象, the result of the author's stay as a student at the country in 1991. Therefore, and recalling an idea with which the article opened, the reflections of a thinker or creative are conditioned by their own way of seeing that is inserted and rooted in their culture. For Wu Zhiliang, the Portuguese are still the descendants of the sea heroes who arrived in China and Macau, fearlessly crossing the Atlantic, Indian and Pacific oceans and, in our days, they are the great drivers of the cultural dialogue of the 16th century, providing a meeting of cultures that was extremely beneficial for the Chinese, because it opened them to other worlds, awakening them to a way that is complementary to the Chinese, which he describes as submissive and peaceful. What is most valued in the introduction and conclusion of the successive portraits of Portugal provided by these Chronicles are the new characteristics that the Chinese and other Eastern peoples are confronted with in their relationship with the Portuguese, above all, the active, restless and restless spirit, which crossed "the magic of Allah with the Indian Bodhisattvas, the Chinese Tao and Japanese meditation with the totally restless spirit of the West. At the source of the discovering, spiritualized and empty force, East and the West converge into one in this humble and silent “void”, the root of all things that transforms into an immense and infinite freedom.騷動的精神，來發現力的本源，在那裡，神意味着虛無。在這力的源泉中，東西方交融在一處，我們在“無”這個萬物之本的謙卑和寂寞中，變得無比自由。》(Wu, 1991,1/ 2). Wu Zhiliang emphasizes throughout the work and, also in the final notes, that the various meetings, including academic ones, provided by institutions in the territory of Macau are an invaluable contribution to friendship and cultural dialogue, this being the correct perspective from the author's point of view to evaluate the role of the Portuguese in the world, which in contemporary times still goes back to its great historical past, much like what happens to Portuguese thinkers and writers, even the most impartial, as is the case of Miguel Torga (1907-1995). This writer born in São Martinho de Anta, a doctor by profession, knows his people well, their joys and sadness, riches, miseries and overcoming. In a very well-executed portrait of the country in Salazar times, Portugal writes, the first edition of which dates back to Coimbra in 1950, assuming very clear perspectives in relation to the Portuguese historical past at home and beyond its borders. Behind the borders dominates the maritime, versatile, cosmopolitan and adventurous capital of Lisbon against the telluric city of Porto, realistic and focused on its roots. Throughout the work, he weaves timely and incisive considerations about the Portuguese mentality, which lead to an image that today perhaps resonates with adventurous people in the character of the soap opera Senhor Ventura, a work dated 1991. This one takes us to China. Returning to Portugal, the author debuts the work in Minho where he makes considerations about the way in which the impoverished Portuguese relate to the life of the sea and emigration: "From time to time he may have a fit of rage and try to escape from himself. A hopeless illusion. Where he arrives will always be him, dying of homesickness and dreaming of returning to the adventure with a small reform. As a balm, he will be left with the narcissism of his exploits past experiences and the somatic satisfaction of seeing the worlds he discovered and civilized grow and progress.” (Torga, 2003, 17). Many were emigrants from the old regime who left just like today: the difference is that today they are much better prepared and educated. The Portuguese who emigrate are, for the most part, qualified professionals holding various degrees and national diplomas, boasting solid training and a desire for the rest of the world. But if people have evolved in social terms, their mentality has not changed that much in terms of the way they relate to their historical past, nor in the taste for risk and adventure that drives them out of the country. The hope will always be that of a better life, although the steps to achieve it are not always well measured. When the author describes Trás-os-Montes, his birthplace, he tells us about the emigrants "Haunted by necessity and the love of adventure, at the age of twenty (if it was not earlier), after militancy, some emigrate to the Arabian overseas. Brazil, Africa and Oceania, they put the whole chimera in a bag of scraps and off they go" (Torga, 2003, 50). This is a trait of the Portuguese mentality that has remained in a constant regime since the Discoveries, the desire and need to leave not only due to lack of opportunities, but also due to the thirst for adventure, as well as the naturalness of miscegenation, which can be seen in the capital of Portugal since the times of “Dona Filipa de Lencastre giving birth on behalf of the Portuguese herd from abroad” (Torga, 2003, 77), or even further, since the very foundation of the land. derived from the energy of a son of a French father and a Spanish mother. However, the greatest danger for Portugal and the community as a whole is, according to Torga's perspective, wasting the soul strength of the Portuguese and their characteristics on inconsequential adventures that can contribute nothing to their individual life projects and/or the common good, but which we narcissistically insist on reliving. He tells us about Lisbon "Narcissus that we were also one day, a destiny like that of Cephisus's son awaited us. Lisbon is that flower that destiny transformed us into; the Tagus, the river where we lost ourselves contemplating our own image" (Torga, 2003, 136). It is precisely this mix of pride, vanity and initiative that the work O Senhor Ventura shows. The protagonist is a man from Penedono, in Alentejo, but with multiple resources and capable of taking on any work. With a powerful and bullish constitution, after an adventurous experience of military service that led him to Macau and a short romance with Júlia, the daughter of the Governor's secretary, he deserted the army and joined the world as a sailor aboard a ship doing cabotage in the China Sea. From there he became an employee in a Ford garage in Beijing, where he befriended Pereira, a man from Minho who cooked very well, and he was his companion on adventures until his death. However, Ventura falls into the good graces of Ford's boss, Mr. Hughes, for being “a man of pulse and initiative” (Torga, 2003, 26). In life, he did a bit of everything, trafficking drugs and weapons, being a pirate, kidnapping, driving 200 trucks to Mongolia and, to his misfortune, he fell in love with a Russian woman with an unrecommended life, Tatiana. Although warned, even by himself, because the couple got along very badly, he wanted to marry her, with whom he had a son, Sérgio. It was then that he decided to get rich by getting involved in drug trafficking, more specifically heroin. This new branch of activity went badly for him, he was discovered by the Chinese authorities and he had to return to Portugal, leaving his son in the care of his wife, who betrayed him as soon as she turned her back. He returned to Alentejo within a period of 5 years so that the Chinese authorities would forget about the matter. Anyway, he was in Portugal and returned to China when he discovered that his wife had cheated on him. He looked for her everywhere until, already dying, she was the one who found him to close his eyes on his deathbed. The word that best characterizes Mr. Ventura is, according to the author, “Action – was his great word.” (Torga, 2003,64). The writer is careful to warn about this story: “at each stop I do nothing more than try a small meditation on destiny, which is more collective than individual” (Torga, 2003, 70), adding that the fact that the Alentejo native is returning to the land is an imperative call from destiny, to put him back in touch with his roots, in a new opportunity for life. The protagonist rejects the chance, due to the obsession he felt with his Russian passion and which will lead him to death, ending the author with the following reflection: “Strange hands buried the poor adventurer's withered body the next day in the foreign land where he had to pay the price for his adventures.” (Torga, 2003, 100). Of the two foreign and most distant images from the Portuguese, one critical and playful by the hands of the French artist Fabrice Caro (Fabcaro), another uplifting and very positive transmitted by the Chinese thinker, Wu Zhiliang, to which is added a third, more realistic and closer transmitted by the Portuguese writer, it cannot be concluded that there is just one true one. The collective portrait can only be obtained together and in a kind of Nietzschean perspectivism from the essential traits of the contemporary Portuguese mentality, shaped, as the French artist saw well, by centuries of erasure, but also by the awareness of the glorious exploits of an intercultural past that continues to the present, according to Wu Zhiliang, or even by the thirst for action and adventure which, when not properly structured and rooted in solid individual and collective plans, can lead to a inopportune dead end. item.title: Decolonization in Timor-Leste left deep traumas in the Portuguese military, argues researcher
item.description: The researcher at the Institute of Contemporary History at Universidade Nova Zélia Pereira stated that the decolonization process in Timor-Leste left deep traumas in the Portuguese military, leading many to silence during the period of Indonesian occupation. “The decolonization process in Timor, in addition to the trauma of the Indonesian invasion for the Timorese themselves, left profound traumas for the Portuguese military, personal and psychological traumas, consequences for their professional careers, most of them ended up abandoning military life, because they were successively passed over for promotions,” the researcher told Lusa. “Lemos Pires, when he was promoted to general, there was an internal campaign against him,” he said. General Mário Lemos Pires was the last governor of Portuguese Timor (between November 8, 1974 and November 27, 1975). Zélia Pereira is coordinating, together with Pedro Aires de Oliveira, professor of History at the Faculty of Social and Human Sciences at Universidade Nova, the reissue of the report prepared by the commission for the analysis and clarification of the decolonization process of Timor-Leste, created by former President Ramalho Eanes, which will include declassified testimonies from military and civilian personnel heard in 1975 and 1976. The project is being financed by the Foundation for Science and Technology, with the support of the commission for the celebration of the 50th anniversary of the 25th of April, as part of a competition for exploratory projects. "It is such a huge trauma that throughout the entire period of Indonesian occupation, apart from Lemos Pires, no other soldier wanted to speak. After the referendum, some memoirs began to be published and only now more recently have they started to agree to do some interviews", explained the researcher. According to Zélia Pereira, the testimonies given in 1976, with the “very fresh memory” and the “very vivid trauma” will allow access to a very “detailed, very interesting” set of information. The researcher also hopes that these testimonies will help the Timorese to “better understand a period that was very traumatic for them”. “We need to understand the following, even today books continue to be published, articles that replicate all the accusations made in 1975. In doctoral and master's theses, because they are based on books published in the 70s, 80s, 2000s, up until the present and which still today are based on ideas and assumptions, which are not all 100% wrong, but which need to have other interpretations”, he highlighted. History, said Zélia Pereira, is about placing several contexts under analysis simultaneously, because no one owns the truth. “What we want is for this to open up other perspectives, other research perspectives, and heal hurts, reconcile people with their past, regardless of whether they made decisions that didn’t turn out to be the right ones,” he added. Timor-Leste became independent from Portugal on November 28, 1975, but nine days later, on December 7, it was occupied by Indonesia.

item.title: Venezuela | Maduro declares that country will never be defeated
item.description: The President of Venezuela declared yesterday that the country will never be defeated and that the Venezuelan people will respond to what he considered to be a psychological war orchestrated by the United States. Speaking to the official Venezuelan television station VTV, Nicolás Maduro stated that the authorities and people of Venezuela will respond with work and achievements to the “psychological war”, referring to the North American Administration as “media scoundrels” from Miami. “How do you say ‘imbecile’ in English?” asked Maduro, warning those “who want to do harm” will never be able to defeat Venezuela. Washington has intensified military operations off Venezuela in recent days, reiterating accusations against Maduro that he promotes drug trafficking. The North American head of state, Donald Trump, also authorized new attacks against vessels, allegedly belonging to drug trafficking networks, near the Venezuelan coast. Maduro added that Venezuelan security forces have seized 63 tons of drugs since the beginning of the year. On the other hand, the Venezuelan leader also denounced the attempt to enter Venezuela by two planes linked to drug trafficking. In the same speech, Maduro declared that Venezuela and Russia are making progress in military cooperation, which he described as peaceful and fruitful. Daily contact Asked about contacts between Caracas and Moscow in the context of “threats” from the United States, Maduro stated that the government maintains daily communication with Russian President Vladimir Putin on “several developing issues”, including military matters. On Sunday, the Russian Presidency admitted having maintained contacts with Venezuela regarding a possible request for help from Maduro to Putin. At the same time, the People's Republic of China stated that there is normal cooperation between Beijing and Caracas. The North American newspaper Washington Post reported that the Venezuelan President asked Russia, China and Iran for help to defend the country from pressure from the United States. For Beijing, this is cooperation between sovereign states and is not directed against third parties. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Mao Ning said at a press conference that China supports strengthening international cooperation to combat “transnational crime” and opposes the use or threat of such force in international relations.

item.title: Pop Mart, maker of Labubu, falls 10.8% in Hong Kong amid doubts about growth
item.description: Shares in Pop Mart, the Chinese company responsible for the global phenomenon of Labubu figures, sank 10.8% this Thursday, the biggest drop since April, in a new episode of volatility that contrasts with the good sales results released the day before. The devaluation reflects investors' growing caution regarding the possibility of a slowdown in the company's growth, after several quarters driven by the popularity of its collectible products. On Wednesday, Pop Mart shares rose 4.23% on the Hong Kong stock exchange, despite the negative tone of the market, following the announcement that revenue in the third quarter increased between 245% and 250%, driven by Labubu's virality on social media and the company's international expansion. According to data provided by the company, domestic sales grew 190%, while international sales soared 370%, highlighted by increases of 175% in the Asia-Pacific region, more than 740% in Europe and almost 1,270% in the United States. The strong drop recorded today is largely attributed to profit taking, after appreciation of more than 186% since the beginning of the year, and uncertainty about the sustainability of the current growth rate. The stock fell 8.1% on Tuesday, its worst performance since April, weighed down by fears of a slowdown in sales after months of euphoria. The preliminary release of results helped to temporarily dispel these concerns, but the absence of an official date for the presentation of the accounts maintains uncertainty regarding the company's future evolution. Executive chairman and founder Wang Ning expressed confidence in the long-term resilience of the Labubu character, arguing that cultural icons continue to generate revenue even after peak popularity. According to the Bloomberg agency, the explosion in demand forced the company itself to revise its internal goals upwards. If at the beginning of 2024 Pop Mart predicted a turnover of 2,800 million dollars (around 2,400 million euros), in August Wang raised this target to 4,200 million dollars (3,600 million euros), pointing to the brand's global momentum as a key factor. Founded in Beijing in 2010, Pop Mart has established itself as one of the main Asian references in the toy and collectible figures sector, combining exclusive design, limited editions and collaborations with international brands, artists and franchises. Its business model is based on so-called “surprise boxes”, which encourage repeat purchases and have created a community of fans willing to pay high premiums for rare pieces. Among its main lines is Labubu, a monster with pointy ears and a mischievous smile inspired by Norse mythology, created by Hong Kong artist Lung Ka-sing in 2015 and integrated into the company's portfolio in 2019.

item.title: LAG | Government restricts the use of “Western” devices because they represent a “risk”
item.description: The Government is betting on Chinese electronic devices, to avoid risks associated with equipment coming from countries with a “hostile stance” towards China. Wong Sio Chak revealed that all public servants, including Portuguese, will take an oath of loyalty to China and Macao by the end of the year The Government revealed on Friday that the Public Administration is giving priority to Chinese electronic devices, because those coming from Western countries “with a hostile stance towards China” represent “a risk”. “Instructions have already been issued by the DSAFP [Directorate of Administration and Public Function Services], especially for critical infrastructures,” said the Macau Secretary for Administration and Justice. “We considered, as a priority, the use of devices from our country” in RAM’s government services and departments, highlighted Wong Sio Chak. The leader admitted to the Legislative Assembly that “there is a risk” in the supply of electronic telecommunications devices. “It is a very sensitive issue and one in which there is also a fragility”, said Wong, pointing the finger at “Western countries, especially some with a hostile stance towards China”. However, the secretary highlighted, during the presentation of the Lines of Government Action for 2026 in the area of ​​Administration and Justice, that the limitations only apply to the public administration of Macau. "We have an open market and we will not restrict the private sector to use foreign devices. Entities and the private sector have the freedom to choose these devices", explained Wong. On October 19, the Central Government accused the United States of carrying out a cyber-attack against the National Time Service Center (NTSC), responsible for maintaining the accuracy of the country's official time. The Chinese Ministry of State Security said the “systematic and long-planned” attack began in 2022, through a vulnerability in the SMS (short message) service of a “foreign brand” of mobile phones. The vulnerability made it possible to “covertly attack and gain control of the cell phones of several NTSC employees and steal confidential data stored on them”, said the ministry. Faithful and loyal Another highlight of Wong Sio Chak's presentation was the oath of loyalty to China and the Macao SAR that all public servants, including those of Portuguese nationality, will have to take by the end of the year. The oath is part of a review of the statutes of management and leadership staff and Public Administration workers, which came into force on 1 November. The two revised laws determine that workers already in office have 90 days to take the oath, with refusal automatically implying the annulment of the appointment to the position or dismissal. But the secretary for Administration and Justice said he believes the process will be completed sooner and that “all public service workers will take the oath by the end of this year”. Wong Sio Chak, who took office on October 16, defended during the presentation of the Governing Action Lines for 2026 that the review “improved the management and accountability regime of management and leadership staff”. On November 1st, 264 directors of public entities and services took an oath in a ceremony, declaring that “they will dedicate themselves with all loyalty to the Macau Special Administrative Region [SAR] of the People's Republic of China”. In a speech given during the ceremony, the Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, asked civil service leaders to “firmly safeguard the full governance power of the Chinese Central Government”. In December 2024, the Legislative Assembly approved, unanimously and without any debate, the law that provides that public servants in Macau can be dismissed if they carry out “acts contrary” to their oath. A month earlier, when presenting the proposal, the then Executive Council spokesman, André Cheong, warned that public servants could be fired due to private conversations or comments published on social media. The oath will be mandatory for all public officials, including Portuguese ones, but it can be taken in Portuguese, one of Macau's two official languages, along with Chinese. According to the most recent Public Administration Human Resources Report, in 2023 the region had 34,311 public employees. The document does not mention how many have Portuguese nationality, only mentioning that 257 were born in Portugal. The two proposals also oblige public servants to take the oath in a “sincere and solemn” manner. The sincerity of the oath will be assessed by the hierarchical superior and any dismissal may be appealed to the courts. Every head The Government wants to launch, at the beginning of 2026, negotiations with Portugal on an agreement for the reciprocal recognition of civil and commercial judgments. Macau's Secretary for Administration and Justice, Wong Sio Chak, said that he intends to “strengthen judicial cooperation abroad and further expand legal exchange”. According to the LAG report, Macau wants, from the first quarter of 2026, to start negotiating an “agreement on the reciprocal confirmation and enforcement of judicial decisions in civil and commercial matters” with Portugal. However, the document does not mention any date for the conclusion of negotiations and the eventual signing of a final agreement. Macau and Portugal signed an agreement in 2019 regarding the surrender of fugitive offenders, whose criminal legality was called into question by the Portuguese Bar Association. The protocol is not in force, as it was not voted on in the Assembly of the Republic. The Macau LAG report also reveals plans to conclude, by the end of 2026, three agreements with Angola for the transfer of convicted people, the delivery of fugitive offenders and mutual legal assistance in criminal cases. These three agreements with Angola have been mentioned in the Macau LAG since November 2023, and that report pointed to the end of 2024 as a target for concluding the negotiations. Angola and mainland China signed an extradition treaty in 2006, which was only approved by the Angolan Parliament in 2011, and was ratified by the Government of Luanda two years later. During the discussion in the Angolan Parliament, the then Angolan deputy minister of Justice, João Monteiro, defended the importance of the agreement due to the large migratory movement between the two countries. At the time, authorities estimated that close to 50,000 Chinese lived in Angola, working mainly in construction, in reconstruction projects financed largely by loans granted by China. João Monteiro guaranteed that the two States agreed that extradition requests cannot include crimes of a political or military nature. Macau Simplex Wong Sio Chak reiterated to the deputies an old promise from the Administration and Justice department: administrative simplification.
