The government priority will aim to speed up processes and licenses, for example, for commercial establishments. In response to a question from Deputy Si Ka Lon, the Secretary for Administration and Justice said that, “as long as there are no major works”, a food and beverage establishment can obtain a license to operate in two days, upon presentation of all the required documents. The government official stressed that behind the flexibility of the administration machine are the concepts of “simplifying, decentralizing and optimizing”. Get to work The Secretary for Administration and Justice stated in the Legislative Assembly that the Government will continue efforts to implement the quota system for Public Service workers and reorganize some careers, eliminating those that are outdated and promoting mobility. Wong Sio Chak highlighted that since the launch of the quota management system in the Administration, in 2020, the number of public servants has increased, and that before changing the rules for progression or access between careers in the administrative machinery, the Government will listen to workers.

item.title: Louvre | France to reinforce security at cultural sites after theft
item.description: The French Minister of Internal Affairs, Laurent Nuñez, will reinforce security measures in all cultural establishments, the press office announced yesterday, following a jewelry theft at the Louvre Museum in Paris. The decision was taken after a meeting with his government colleague in charge of Culture, Rachida Dati, said the same ministerial source, cited by the French news agency AFP. The institution, in the center of the French capital, remained closed yesterday, one day after a group, still at large, managed to steal multiple works of jewelry art. "The Louvre Museum will remain closed today (yesterday) for exceptional reasons. We apologize for the inconvenience", read a message published on the museum's official website. A group of four men stole jewelry on Sunday morning, in just a few minutes and when the museum was already open and with visitors inside, using a forklift machine, parked on the respective bank of the River Seine, and raising it to the height of a window on the first floor of the building. The group took eight pieces “of inestimable heritage value”, including the tiara of Empress Eugenie (wife of Napoleon III, emperor from 1852 to 1870) and two necklaces, the French Ministry of Culture reported on Sunday. That jewel alone has 212 pearls and 1,998 diamonds, according to the Louvre's description, while the pieces belonging to Queen Maria Amélia have multiple sapphires and hundreds of diamonds. This Parisian museum is the largest and most visited in the world, with nine million people enjoying part of the 35,000 works that the institution houses, in its 73 thousand square meters of space.

item.title: Cuts leave 13.7 million people at risk of extreme hunger
item.description: Os cortes no financiamento da ajuda humanitária podem expor até 13,7 milhões de pessoas à fome extrema em todo o mundo, alertou ontem o Programa Alimentar Mundial (PAM). “O sistema de ajuda humanitária está sob forte pressão com a retirada dos parceiros das áreas da linha da frente, criando um vazio”, afirmou a agência sediada em Roma num novo relatório intitulado “Uma bóia salva-vidas em perigo”. The UN agency said that six of its operations – in Afghanistan, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Haiti, Somalia, South Sudan and Sudan – are “facing major disruptions, which will only worsen”. WFP warned that its financing “has never been so challenging”, anticipating “a 40 percent drop” in 2025, “which will translate into a projected budget of US$6.4 billion, compared to US$10 billion in 2024”. The report does not name any countries, but points to a study published in the medical journal The Lancet, which found that 14 million additional deaths worldwide from disease, nutritional deficiencies and maternal and perinatal conditions could occur by 2030 as a result of cuts in US humanitarian aid alone. Returns and records Since US President Donald Trump's return to the White House, Washington has announced massive cuts in its foreign aid, dealing a huge blow to humanitarian operations around the world. "Program coverage has been significantly reduced and rations cut. Vital assistance to families in food disaster situations [Phase 5 of the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification/IPC] is threatened, while preparedness for future impacts has significantly decreased," warns WFP. Globally, “WFP estimates that its funding gaps could push 10.5 to 13.7 million people currently in acute food insecurity (IPC Phase 3) into a humanitarian emergency (IPC Phase 4),” the organization added. The UN agency said global hunger has now reached record levels, with 319 million people facing acute food insecurity — including 44 million at emergency levels.

item.title: Death | António Coelho dies aged 77, but leaves a legacy in Portuguese gastronomy
item.description: The founder of Restaurante António died on Sunday in Macau, due to heart problems. Behind him, he leaves a mark and an innovative concept for promoting Portuguese food in Asia A father, a friend and one of the great ambassadors of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia. Chef António Coelho died on Sunday, aged 77, due to heart problems, but leaves behind a professional career spanning almost 40 years and an influence that can be felt in several restaurants and Portuguese food chefs in Macau. Born in Portugal in 1948, António Coelho's first contact with Macau took place in 1970, when he had to complete his four-year mandatory military service. After two years, the land remained in his memory, but the future chef chose to return to Europe. Em Portugal, começa por trabalhar na Segurança Social, mudando, mais tarde, para num laboratório de análises clínicas. Foi nesta área que desenvolveu o gosto pela gastronomia, não pelo trabalho, mas pelos vários almoços e jantares em diferentes restaurantes. Cada vez mais interessado na cozinha, António decide empregar-se, em 1984, num restaurante, onde admitiu ter aprendido a cozinhar, de acordo com uma entrevista ao jornal South China Morning Post, de 2018. The first years of António Coelho's new career were spent in Portugal, where he performed different roles as manager-administrator of the Botequim do Rei restaurant or director of the catering department at the Grande Hotel da Curia. In 1996, he had his first international experience, as director of the restaurant department at the Hotel Trópico, in Cape Verde. The experience lasts one year. Creating a legacy Returning to Macau in 1997, António worked for 10 years in different spaces, such as the restaurants Frol de la Mar, Lusitano, Lisbon, and also had a brief stay in Hong Kong, in 2002, at Restaurante Inn. However, the decisive step towards his affirmation as one of the most influential chefs of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia came in 2007, with the opening of Restaurante António. And the success that followed was not the result of chance, as said by Edgar Rodrigues, a chef who came to Macau to work on the launch of the project: “The success was based on the recipes, the quality of the food, but also the very professionalism”, says Edgar Rodrigues, to HM. "He was very attentive to his customers. If there was an order for clams à bolhão pato, he would have different recipes adapted to the nationality. For example, Koreans don't like coriander, the recipe for them didn't have coriander. Chinese customers like little salt, they were served with little salt, and locals like the more traditional recipe. In a single dish there were several ways of cooking, just to satisfy different customers", he recalls. Cristiano Tavares, currently chef at the Macalhau restaurant, also came to Macau to work at the António Restaurant. He believes that the chef found a position for Portuguese food that still influences other restaurants today. “I think his success was due to his way of being, he was a politically correct person, he had a way of working that pleased both Chinese, Korean and Japanese tourists”, explained Cristiano Tavares, to HM. "We were a street restaurant with four or five cooks. He managed to do what many large restaurants still cannot do today. Nowadays there are many restaurants with Portuguese food that open in Macau, but follow the example of what he did", he considered. Quality and spectacle In addition to the food, Restaurante António customers were seduced by the “show”. This is the vision of Marcelino Marques, António's friend and musician who for several years livened up the space's nights, with traditional Portuguese music. "The quality of the food made the space popular. He took great care in choosing the food and drinks served. He went to Portugal to choose wines from various regions, such as Douro or Alentejo, all of high quality, which were bottled under the António brand. People knew they weren't going to pay little, not that it was a space with luxury prices, it wasn't, but the quantity served wasn't small", recalled Marcelino Marques. However, the musician believes that the success was also due to a concept in which the meal was also a spectacle: "People liked listening to Portuguese music, but also being with António. He was an affable, big person and appeared in that white jacket with the flags of Portugal, China and Macau and people liked his presence and asked him to take photographs", he says. "He also opened a bottle of champagne with a sword. He did a whole ceremony and people really liked it. It was a spectacle and a party to see the cork flying out of the bottle. It worked well", he recalled. Marcelino Marques recalls that the food and the show made the restaurant very famous, especially among Japanese, Korean and Hong Kong tourists. The musician reveals that Japanese tourists booked days in advance. And this factor also contributed to the fact that António offered a glass of port wine at the end of the meal, which also led to the recognition of the Port Wine Confraternity. The success of Restaurante António led the chef to sell the space to an investment fund, becoming an ambassador for the space. The break with the fund happened in 2020, when he was fired without just cause. The case ended up in court, with António winning the case. In recent years, António took on the position of executive chef at Angela’s Café and Lounge, at the Hotel Lisboeta. A father, a friend Due to his work in Macau, António was distinguished, in 2013, by the Macao SAR Government with the MSAR Tourist Merit Medal. Also in 2015, he received the merit medal for Portuguese communities from the Portuguese Government. However, for those who worked with him the most important thing was the relationship that went beyond the strictly professional field. "He had a big impact on Macau and for me he was like a second father. When I came to Macau I didn't have an easy life and he always held my hand", confessed Rodrigues. "He was always a person who was there for me. And I always saw him as a man of iron. In everything he did, there was a great will", he pointed out. This is a feeling shared by Cristiano Tavares. "António is my father in Macau. He worked until the last day, always with seriousness, honesty and integrity. He is an example for all the chefs in this area", he said. For Marcelino Marques, António's death is the loss of a friend. "António was the person who welcomed me to Macau and was capable of doing the same to everyone. He was strict and demanding, but he was an excellent person", he described. "Everyone knew him. He was an affable person and received people like no one else", he added.

item.title: LAG | Miguel de Senna Fernandes calls for more focus on Macau
item.description: The president of the Association of Macanese, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, defended the importance of regional integration, but highlighted that Macau is going through a “delicate” moment and needs more attention from the Government. Senna Fernandes' position was taken in statements to Canal Macau. "Macau is integrated into the Greater Bay Area, nothing other than improvements are expected to accelerate the development of the Greater Bay Area. But, we cannot forget that we are in Macau. This is fundamental", began by saying the president of the association, regarding the Lines and Governing Action. “There is no citizen, no matter how noble, no matter how much he defends the Government, no matter how much he applauds the Government in this policy and Macau's contribution to development, there is no citizen who does not have Macau as a priority”, he added. In a context in which the recovery of tourism covers society in an unequal way, Miguel de Senna Fernandes asked for more attention to Macau, because it is going through a complicated period: “Despite the economic recovery numbers, we cannot forget that there is still a group of citizens to whom this does not reach”, he stressed. "We need to say the measures, and I'm not saying long-term, but medium-term, to improve the conditions, the future prospects of this layer of workers, of professionals in Macau. Don't just feed the dream of Hengqin, for example. There are people who like to stay in Macau and for them Macau is always the future", he highlighted.

item.title: Work | Johnson Ian criticizes excessive TNR
item.description: Johnson Ian, former candidate for a deputy seat in the Legislative Assembly (AL), argued that the Government did not demonstrate true determination to replace non-resident workers (TNR) with residents in the labor area, in relation to the most recent report on the Lines of Government Action (LAG) for 2026. In the opinion column published in the newspaper Sou Pou, Johnson Ian recalled that one of the highlights of the LAG report, released last week, is the demand from financial and higher education institutions, among others, for the release of more jobs for Macau residents. However, Johnson Ian pointed out that residents have difficulty finding work in the territory because there are many TNR. The official also states in the same article that residents want to work and even intend to take on lower category jobs, but companies have no desire to recruit them. Johnson Ian cited official data showing that there are currently 183 thousand TNR, and, in his opinion, the Government should reduce this number of foreign workers, especially in gaming companies, to alleviate the problem of resident unemployment.

item.title: Economy | EU expresses “concern about political issues”
item.description: Harvey Rouse, head of the European Union (EU) Delegation in Hong Kong and Macau, met with Macau's Secretary for Economy and Finance, Tai Kin Ip, to discuss investment by European companies in the diversification of Macau's economy The European Union (EU) declined to reveal whether Au Kam San, detained with Portuguese nationality, was mentioned in a meeting with Macau authorities, in which a European representative demonstrated “concern about political issues”. On Thursday, the head of the European Union (EU) Delegation in Hong Kong and Macau, Harvey Rouse, wrote on social media that he had met with Macau's Secretary for Economy and Finance, Tai Kin Ip. The two spoke about how European companies can support “the economic diversification” of Macau, which is highly dependent on tourism, and “the continued development” of the neighboring special economic zone of Hengqin (Mountain Island). “I also expressed concern about political issues,” added Briton Rouse. Asked by Lusa whether he had discussed the detention of former deputy Au Kam San with Anton Tai, the British diplomat did not respond. “We do not comment on the specific content of bilateral meetings,” the EU Delegation in Hong Kong and Macau told Lusa, in a written response. “In our meetings with the Macau authorities, we regularly raise concerns about political and legal changes in the MSAR [Special Administrative Region of Macau], in line with the EU Annual Report on Macau, including on individual cases,” the delegation added. On September 11, the European Commission warned that the “insistence on national security by the Macau government” is leading to “limiting the space for pluralistic voices from both politics and society”. Uncomfortable revisions In a report, the commission gave as an example the review of electoral laws for the leader of the Government and for the local parliament, to exclude candidates considered unpatriotic. On July 31, Macau police announced the arrest of pro-democracy activist Au Kam San, in the first case under the region's national security law, which came into force in 2009 and whose scope was expanded in 2023. On September 10, during a visit to Macau, Portuguese Prime Minister Luís Montenegro admitted that he did not speak about Au Kam San with the leader of the local government, Sam Hou Fai, and argued that the case requires “the necessary discretion” and “some modesty”. On October 21, the president of the Court of Final Instance of Macau, Song Man Lei, declared that the local justice system has an “indispensable duty” to judge “fairly, independently and professionally” national security cases, as well as “to ensure that all acts that offend the security of the State are punished in accordance with the law”. Recently, after the presentation of the Government Action Lines for 2026, Sam Hou Fai briefly addressed the detention of Au Kam San for the first time. “In August, we had the first case related to the national security law,” he said at a press conference, without mentioning the name of the activist. The accusation is not yet known and there is no information about who will defend the former deputy.

item.title: Sam Hou Fai highlights national security as the path of the future
item.description: The Chief Executive highlighted that the Macao SAR must “firmly defend the sovereignty, security and development interests of the country” in the coming years, in order to realize the “spirit of the Fourth Plenary Session of the 20th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China”. The statements were made on Saturday, at a meeting that took place at Forum Macau. In his closing speech at the event, Sam Hou Fai also highlighted the need to develop “Macau in all aspects”, an objective that he said would only be possible if society knows how to “correctly identify, manage appropriately and actively seek changes”. In addition to security, the Head of Government indicated that the spirit of the Central Committee plenary session is to “promote the patriotic spirit, boost social vitality and increase the efficiency of governance in accordance with the law”. In this sense, he promised to “strengthen collaboration mechanisms with associations that love the country and Macau, thus consolidating its foundation of administration in favor of grassroots social communities”. In relation to associations, the Government hopes that they will be bridges for communicating ideas between the Executive and society. Find more friends As a third aspect, Sam Hou Fai indicated the need to “proactively seize the opportunities arising from development, promoting the adequate diversification of the economy and the sustainable development of Macau society”. The Chief Executive did not forget the campaigns to involve the Macao SAR in the global panorama by contributing to the construction of the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area, participation in the One Belt, One Road initiative, and strengthening “interconnections with the interior and exterior”. These were the ways presented to expand Macau’s “international ‘circle of friends’” and assume “the role of ‘precise interlocutor’ between China and Portuguese and Spanish-speaking countries”.

item.title: Culture | Tensions between China and Japan postpone meeting in Macau
item.description: A meeting of the “Cities of Culture of East Asia” was scheduled for today in Macau with ministers from China, South Korea and Japan. However, the initiative was canceled by Beijing, due to growing tension with Japan, following statements by the Japanese Prime Minister The meeting in Macau between the Ministers of Culture of China, Japan and the Republic of Korea, which was originally scheduled for today, was postponed, without a new date being set. The announcement was made on Thursday by Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Mao Ning, cited by Xinhua. According to information from the state agency, the Chinese spokesperson stated “that a Japanese leader openly made highly erroneous statements about Taiwan, which hurt the feelings of the Chinese people, challenged the post-World War II international order and undermined the basis and environment for cooperation between China, Japan and the Republic of Korea.” Mao Ning also said that the “Japanese leader’s” statements led “to a situation in which there are still no conditions to hold the meeting”. Although Xinhua does not identify the “Japanese leader”, the target is Sanae Takaichi, Prime Minister of Japan. The first woman to lead the Executive of the country of the rising sun stated, on November 7, in parliament, that an attack from the Interior on the Island of Taiwan would be seen in Japan as a situation that would “threaten the survival” of the country. In response, Xue Jian, consul general of the People's Republic of China in Osaka, wrote a post on the social network The publication was eventually deleted after a diplomatic protest from Japan. Rising tension In light of the diplomatic incident, the Government of China started to demand that Sanae Takaichi publicly retract the statements made in the Japanese parliament, which has been refused. Without Japanese backtracking, China issued a security alert on tourist travel, which was followed by the governments of Macau and Hong Kong. The Interior did not stop at the warning for tourists and forced airline companies to cancel flights to Japan, travel agencies to cancel hotel stays, blocked imports of Japanese seafood again, postponed the entry of Japanese films into the domestic market and issued a warning to students who intend to study in Japan. The meeting scheduled for today in Macau aimed to promote “exchange and mutual learning” between the three countries and was presented as a selection of the “Cities of Culture in East Asia”, which includes Macau. The Macao SAR Government portal dedicated to the event also stated that the meeting was “seen as a relevant achievement for humanity” and “a mark of cultural cooperation in East Asia”.

item.title: Commercial spaces | Bill presented
item.description: The Housing Institute (IH) presented to the Council for Public Housing Affairs and associations the proposal to amend the decree-law that regulates the allocation, rental and free transfer of spaces suitable for the exercise of commercial activities that exist in buildings intended for social housing. Regulations regarding the Building Repair Fund were also discussed. According to a statement released yesterday by IH, “participants basically agreed with the proposed legislative changes”. The institute committed to defining the concrete content of the two proposed legislative changes, taking into account the opinions collected. IH also recalled that it recently held a meeting with the Council for Public Housing Affairs and three presentation sessions, with the aim of listening to the opinions of members and more than 20 social and professional associations, with the participation of more than 80 people.

item.title: Construction | Requests job guarantees for residents
item.description: Leong Pou U, elected indirectly, is concerned about the difficulties local construction workers face in finding work. Despite praising the Executive's efforts to reduce the unemployment rate, he calls for more measures aimed at bricklayer jobs Deputy Leong Pou U questioned the Government about the measures that will be adopted to guarantee priority access for residents to jobs in the construction sector. The question is part of a written question from the deputy linked to the Federation of Workers' Associations of Macau (FAOM). The legislator begins by indicating that conditions for local workers are increasingly difficult: “Since the beginning of this year, affected by the reduction in private construction projects and public works, construction workers have, in general, faced insufficient working hours, with stagnant wages for several years, which puts pressure on their livelihoods”, he argues. The deputy also praised the measure taken by Sam Hou Fai's Executive to create the Working Group for the Coordination of Employment Promotion, considering that it is effective in collecting information on job vacancies and needs in various sectors. However, he calls for greater use of this work: “Given the increasing employment pressure faced by construction workers, it is necessary for the Government to take further advantage of the role of the Working Group for the Coordination of Employment Promotion to introduce more targeted measures to help them secure employment”, he pointed out. In this sense, the deputy wants to know if the Government has defined “guidelines for the priority hiring of local residents in subcontracted public works projects” and if it will require that when there are public works an increasingly greater proportion of local residents is defined. Leong Pou U considers it essential to ensure that the local population is in a situation of full employment. List of compliments Despite the warnings about the employment situation in construction, Leong Pou U's written statement praises the Government. Leong highlights that between July and September, the unemployment rate is 1.8 percent, and that in the case of resident employment it does not exceed 2.4 percent. Positive values ​​for the legislator, who highlights that “the employment situation continued to improve with the decline in unemployment rates” despite the “large influx of recent graduates into the job market”, which shows “the Government's effective efforts in promoting employment among residents”.

item.title: Presidents for all tastes
item.description: The electoral campaign for candidates for President of the Republic is on the road. The suitors for the Belém palace are more than many and for all tastes. On January 18th of next year, the Portuguese people are, once again, called to go to the polls to vote for whoever intends to be the new President of Portugal. There are candidates from the extreme right to the extreme left. The vote is secret, but most people already have an idea who they will vote for. One thing is certain: the Portuguese want to continue living in democracy and do not accept xenophobic, racist and neo-Nazi theories. Polls are worth what they are worth. They usually make mistakes in the final result. However, certain television channels have done everything to influence the vote in a certain direction. Today, I leave you with what we think of each of the candidates. André Ventura – Um candidato anti-sistema político em vigor, que tem defendido o ódio pelos imigrantes, que preconiza uma mudança nas leis da nacionalidade e até na própria Constituição da República. É visível que apenas se candidata para tentar manter a sua base eleitoral para futuras eleições legislativas, apesar de o seu Partido Chega, ter vindo a perder adeptos. In the television debates he has participated in, he only knows how to shout and present the same arguments that he has announced since he founded the party. It is not even possible that he will be able to participate in a possible second round of the presidential elections. Marques Mendes – The former television commentator and PSD leader decided to run because his partner Luís Montenegro assured him that he would have the support of the PSD/CDS Democratic Alliance, which currently governs the country. Marques Mendes presents himself as a faction candidate. Without a doubt, supporters of the Montenegro government will vote for him. However, not all PSD activists support this candidacy. For these activists, Marques Mendes is Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa number two, with less knowledge of constitutional legislation. The polls created for his appreciation have already presented him as being ahead of voting intentions. We sincerely do not believe that the people will choose a President who would just go to Belém to defend all of Montenegro's proposals. Almirante Gouveia e Melo – A candidate who immediately received, upon announcing his candidacy, overwhelming popular support for having been a man of seriousness and organization when the Covid-19 virus pandemic hit. Some once again support a military man for the Presidency of Portugal. Others are radically against the election of a military officer. They say he has no political experience and cannot explain what political area he is in. How can a citizen who becomes an admiral not know politics? How is it that you have not followed the vicissitudes of politics in the 50 years of democracy? Impossible. Gouveia e Melo knows perfectly well what support he has and what ideas he has to be a different President. The problem is that their political opponents know that Gouveia e Melo knows too much, for example, who received “gloves” in the acquisition of the high-tech submarines Arpão and Tridente, and there was no investigation by the Public Ministry when the German participants in the deal were arrested. His opponents want to remove him at all costs, as Gouveia e Melo knows all the ins and outs of those who want to remove him. He is one of the strong candidates to win the elections, in the first or second round. António José Seguro – An experienced candidate in politics and academic life where he has maintained extensive contact with young people. He was general secretary of the Socialist Party and after the “war” with António Costa he hibernated. After 10 years, he returns bringing with him his seriousness, his political knowledge of the Portuguese reality and his serenity in analyzing national problems. The Socialist Party, or a part of it, was forced to announce that it supported this candidate. Seguro thanked him for the support, but emphasized his independence. Safe since he announced his candidacy for President, he has gradually risen in the voting intentions of the Portuguese, especially among a moderate “centrão” that includes social democrats and socialists. You may be surprised and go on to a second round. Cotrim Figueiredo – A candidate who was leader of the Liberal Initiative, a party that is more similar to Chega than to the PSD. Cotrim could be a surprise, especially when it comes to voting among young people and women. Personally, he is a cordial person, knowledgeable about political dossiers, with experience in the corridors of the European Parliament and who presents himself as a defender of modern and reformist liberalism. It may surprise in the percentage of votes, but we don't believe it will be enough to contest a second round. The mobilization around Cotrim is being active and influential. Its result will depend greatly on the criticisms it announces against Chega, otherwise, social democratic activists unhappy with Marques Mendes will not support him and may opt to vote for Seguro. António Filipe – This candidate is a Gentleman. Serious, deputy of the Assembly of the Republic for many years, knowledgeable about the Constitution from the first to the last paragraph, affable and popular. He does not deny his communist roots, but he often disagreed with the guidelines of the Central Committee of his party, the PCP. He is a candidate who has traveled the entire country and who sits in cafes listening to people's complaints. He has achieved a support base larger than that of his own party. We have already heard socialists saying that they will vote for his candidacy. António Filipe is cultured, an excellent commentator, a friend of the unprotected and could obtain a surprising result, despite the polls commissioned by the AD placing him as having no electoral significance. Maybe they are wrong. Catarina Martins – The candidate supported by the Bloco de Esquerda should have remained in the insignificance that has been registered in her party, which month after month has seen voters flee to Livre. Catarina has no chance of obtaining a good result, because the crisis raging in the Bloc does nothing to help her win over voters. She knows what she's talking about, she points out errors in Montenegro's governance, she defends the poverty-stricken pensioners, but there is no machine in her candidacy that could promote her to a credible candidate capable of achieving a good result. We will not comment on the candidate of Livre and other pretenders to the “throne” of Belém due to the fact that they have no chance of being elected. In our humble opinion, the elections will be disputed between Gouveia e Melo and Marques Mendes or António José Seguro. And in a second round, if Seguro is present, the entire left will be able to coexist with Álvaro Cunhal's thesis of covering his eyes and putting the cross on Seguro.

item.title: Germany's Strategic Awakening (I)
item.description: (Continuation of the article published in the November 13th edition) After years of broken promises, Germany is now taking the matter seriously. And, suddenly, German rearmament, in the eyes of the same allies who for so long demanded its absolute necessity, seems hardly reassuring. Smiles and handshakes in public, concern behind the scenes, as it can be seen in out of place words, in apparently unjustified decisions and even in the expression of faces. Otherwise, it would be difficult to explain why, in September 2022, Warsaw formally decided to ask Berlin for reparations for the human and material losses suffered during the Nazi occupation, estimated at around 1,300 billion euros. Friendly price, of course. Much more direct was Trump during the meeting with Merz at the White House in June 2025 when he stated that "They are spending more money on defense, and that's a good thing. I'm not sure that General MacArthur thought the same, ... you know what I mean? He said, 'Never let Germany rearm.' care.’” This was followed by a friendly pat on the leg from the German Chancellor saying: “Let’s stay tuned, I’ll take care of it.” The episode ended, to Merz's relief, with forced laughter. The feeling of uncertainty is not only felt in Washington and Warsaw, but also in government circles in London and Paris, where the warnings of Margaret Thatcher and François Mitterrand between 1989 and 1991, when the Wall fell and German reunification, were certainly not forgotten. For example, among German officials there is widespread conviction that French President Emmanuel Macron's proposal to extend the French nuclear arsenal to Germany is, in practice, a maneuver to control its trajectory, preserve French military primacy in the European Union and, at the same time, guarantee the vast financial resources on the other side of the Rhine. Not exactly a gesture of solidarity between allies. The question then arises as to why the West encouraged the strengthening of Berlin's military capabilities for years, only to later, at least in part, regret it? Does this incongruity follow any logic? To respond, it helps to remember a leitmotif that has been circulating in Washington for at least a decade, especially since Barack Obama presented the so-called “Pivot to Asia” (which was a foreign policy strategy launched by President Barack Obama in 2011, which marked a significant shift in the focus of the United States from the Middle East and Europe to Asia-Pacific. The objective was to reinforce the diplomatic, economic and military presence of the United States in the region in the face of the rise of China) that for the United States, it is imperative to transfer the costs to third parties of containing Russian ambitions in Europe, at least on a conventional level. And in this context, the contribution of the Federal Republic, the continent's largest economy, seems inevitable. The problem is who can guarantee that Berlin, after developing its military capabilities as requested by Washington, will use them in a manner consistent with American interests? It is easy to control those who are fragile and defenseless, much less those who are armed to the teeth. In short, Germany's human and industrial capabilities are indispensable, but leaving them in the hands of the Germans is frightening and not a little scary. Nothing new in the Western bloc as we are facing the same contradiction that, at the beginning of the Cold War, led the United States to build its informal empire in Europe. An architecture designed, in large part, to keep the Germans “subdued”, according to the famous formula of the first secretary general of NATO, Lord Ismay. Enemies sitting at friends' table. No American, in the second half of the 1940s, would have consented to the reintegration of Germany (even if divided) into the “family of Western nations” if he had not considered it strictly necessary. In fact, before the end of hostilities, President Franklin Delano Roosevelt openly argued that the Germans should face costs “so impressive that they hesitate before starting a new war.” In his eyes, Germany would be “less dangerous for civilization if divided into 107 provinces”. This is also why, in September 1944, during the Quebec conference, Roosevelt agreed to ratify with Winston Churchill a project that envisaged the transformation of the enemy into a “country with a predominantly agricultural and pastoral character”. The plan, developed in the previous months by then Treasury Secretary Henry Morgenthau with the evocative title “Program to Prevent Germany from Starting a Third World War” envisaged, in essence, stripping the Germans of “all their heavy industries”.

item.title: Who's afraid of the gynecologist?
item.description: As soon as a person with a vulva begins their sexual life, visits to the gynecologist become mandatory. There are those who suggest consultations every year, there are those who recommend intervals every three years — it largely depends on the medical situation. During the consultation, the doctor observes the vulva and the inside of the vagina, performs tests and assesses the health of the private parts. Even though contact with the gynecologist may be frequent, there are those who feel extreme anxiety during these visits. After all, the person is exposed and vulnerable. In addition to having to share details about your sex life and dealing with awkward silences — easily interpreted as judgmental — there is also the discussion about bodily fluids and the use of a vaginal speculum, sometimes metallic and cold, so that the vagina opens and visibility is better. There is associated discomfort and people describe different levels of discomfort, and even pain. What is certain is that, for many, these interventions can be painful — and, therefore, anxiety soars. There are those who even prefer not to go to the gynecologist at all. Starting with the vaginal speculum, for example: it has maintained practically the same shape and function for 185 years. Some doctors still use the cold, metallic model, but it is believed that, nowadays, the disposable plastic model is used more often, which, although a little more comfortable, is not the ideal solution. Two women in the Netherlands at the Technical University of Delf developed an alternative with a less aggressive mechanism, which, in initial studies, proved to be very favorable — not only for the comfort of patients, but also for doctors, who reported better visibility. Lilium, as it is called, is, without a doubt, a promising invention, but it may take some time to reach gynecological offices around the world. The material is softer and the shape of the opening is gentler, even allowing patients to control the opening — which may be relevant for those who suffer from extreme anxiety, have had traumatic sexual experiences or even previous negative experiences at the gynecologist. Some people take the consultation naturally; others avoid it completely. Most, however, resign themselves to the idea that routine consultation is necessary, despite the discomfort it may cause. For the sake of our health, we sometimes subject ourselves to unpleasant procedures — and that's okay: that's how medicine works. However, there are aspects that can be managed so that going to the gynecologist is not a hassle. This is the part that gives us back some agency in the relationship with the gynecological act. How can we take care of discomfort? Establish a relationship of trust. For the experience to be smooth, it is essential that the person establishes a relationship of trust with the doctor. It is worth sharing anxieties and fears regarding the visit, explaining what causes discomfort. Together, they can develop strategies that make exams more bearable (for example, in the case of cytology). You can ask the doctor to explain each step of the procedure. Not all professionals are sensitive to these issues, but it is important to find one with whom we feel comfortable and with whom communication is easy and uncomplicated. If it's your first visit, it's worth asking friends or trusted people for references — and look for doctors who are empathetic and available to listen to concerns. Accompany yourself with comforting objects or circumstances. When going to your appointment, take something that makes you feel safe and reminds you that the discomfort is temporary. For example, listening to relaxing music before entering or using a familiar perfume or scent. It is important to identify these points of well-being and not be afraid to turn to them in a stressful situation. It may also be helpful to bring a trusted companion to stay with you in the waiting room and greet you when you leave. These moments of safety help keep the uncomfortable experience from leaving you feeling emotionally helpless. The world of gynecological medicine still has a lot of room to improve when it comes to care and understanding the discomfort that this type of consultation can generate. Even in the reformulation of examination procedures and instruments, there will certainly be advances that take more account of the comfort of people with a vulva. For now, all we can do is talk about the discomfort with the healthcare professional and look for the one with whom we feel the most trust. Despite the commonplace that going to the gynecologist is “just a little uncomfortable”, we increasingly realize that, for many people, it can be much more than that — and there is nothing like developing strategies that recognize discomfort, but take care of it in the best way possible.

item.title: Pre-prepared food (I)
item.description: Recently, the press reported that a prominent Chinese businessman, after having dinner at a restaurant belonging to a chain in mainland China, expressed his outrage online, saying that the food he had been served was “pre-prepared” and that he had paid an exorbitant price for it. The restaurant chain responded immediately, stating that the dishes he had been served were not “pre-prepared food, but rather made with products from the restaurant chain’s “Central Kitchen Pre-Processing Technology”. This incident sparked lively online discussions surrounding the use of pre-prepared food in restaurants and the consumer's right to be informed—issues worthy of public attention. On March 18, 2024, mainland China issued a “Notice on Strengthening Food Safety Supervision of Pre-prepared Food and Promoting the Development of High-Quality Industry.” The Notice defines pre-prepared food this way: “Pre-prepared food, also known as pre-packaged dishes, refers to meals made from one or more edible agricultural products and their derivatives, with or without seasonings or other auxiliary ingredients, without preservatives, through industrial pre-processing (such as mixing, marinating, frying, roasting, baking, steaming, etc.), with or without seasoning packets, satisfying the storage, transport and sale conditions indicated on the product label, which dishes must be consumed after heating. Does not include staple foods such as frozen rice, noodles, convenience foods, packaged meals, rice bowls, steamed buns, pastries, roujiamo (Chinese hamburger), bread, hamburgers, sandwiches, pizza, etc.” In other words, pre-prepared food is food that is cooked in advance, stored and then taken to the restaurant where it will be heated and served to customers. One point to note is that pre-prepared foods generally have a longer shelf life, which can range from several days to a few months, whereas semi-prepared foods have a much shorter shelf life, typically just one to two days, and require refrigeration. After reading the description of pre-prepared food in the “Notice”, a question arises: Can food prepared in the central kitchen of the restaurant chain and then transported to other branches be considered pre-prepared food? The “Notice on Strengthening Food Safety Supervision of Pre-Prepared Meals and Promoting High-Quality Development of the Industry” clearly stipulates that central kitchens must comply with legal and regulatory food safety requirements and standards in the catering industry; therefore, they are not pre-prepared foods. Mainland China previously requested opinions on “National Food Safety Standards for Pre-Prepared Foods,” and it is believed that new regulations will be issued soon. At that time, more standards regarding this matter will appear. The explanation we gave of the concept of pre-prepared food results from a textual interpretation, but we can, from delicious food, arrive at complex thoughts. Thinking about these questions before eating can be mentally exhausting and reduce the pleasure of the meal. Now let's try to think about what pre-prepared foods are for the average consumer. For most consumers, any food that is not prepared and cooked in the restaurant itself, and that contains some trace of industrial processing, be it a meal kit or a semi-finished product, is considered pre-prepared food. In other words, “it is not freshly cooked, therefore, it is pre-prepared” this is the common understanding about pre-prepared food. Do you, dear reader, also share this idea? Do you agree with the widespread perception? Next week, we will continue to debate this topic and explore how Macau should deal with the matter. Legal Consultant of the Association for the Promotion of Jazz in Macau Associate Professor of the Faculty of Management Sciences of the Macau Polytechnic University Email: cbchan@mpu.edu.mo

item.title: Barra Slow Festival | Coffee and culture in Naval Workshops
item.description: It's called “Barra Slow Festival” and the first edition is scheduled for next weekend, between the 28th and 30th of November, with the aim of revitalizing the Barra area with activities linked to coffee culture, design and crafts. The public will be able to enjoy events at Naval Workshops nº 1 and nº2, as well as in the square located in the area This weekend, namely between Friday and Sunday, the first edition of the “Barra Slow Festival 2025” is taking place in Macau, an event that brings various activities linked to coffee, culture and art and aims to attract public attention to the Barra area, known for tourist sites such as the A-Má Temple. According to an official statement from the event, this is a debut in the territory of events such as “To Play Market × Tokyo Coffee Festival · Macau 2025” and the “Shanghai UNFOLD Art and Design Fair”, as well as initiatives such as “Coffee Rave”, “Macau Chill Collective” and an exhibition by well-known graphic designer Florian Lamm. All these events will be spread across the square in the Barra area and Oficinas Navais nº 1 and nº2, where cultural events usually take place. According to the same note, the “Barra Slow Festival” integrates “popular contemporary elements, such as coffee culture, creative design, visual exhibitions, limited artisanal products and music”, being a “cultural event with selected concepts”. The idea of ​​an event in which there is “human warmth” is defended, encouraging the public “to relax and live intensely, recovering the tranquility inherent to life”. In this way, “the Barra neighborhood was chosen [for this initiative], with tents set up inside and outside the historic buildings of the Naval Workshops”. It is therefore hoped that the general public “can enjoy a cup of coffee, stroll around the area and experience the historical depth of the Barra neighborhood”. From the outside to the inside Above all, the “Barra Slow Festival” brings to Macau events already known in Asia, such as the “Tokyo Coffee Festival”, organized by “To Play Market” and which brings together almost 50 famous coffee brands from Japan, the Greater Bay Area and Macau. “Just a few months ago, the Tokyo Coffee Festival made its debut in Hong Kong, attracting more than 30,000 participants, and both its artisanal coffee and coffee products were highly praised,” highlights the organization. At this premiere in Macau there will be special products for sale and limited editions. Another highlight of the lineup is the “UNFOLD” Art and Design Fair, organized in Shanghai by Shanghai BANANAFISH. This is an event with the curatorial concept of “unfold, read and present”, being a “communication platform that brings together lovers of culture and art, designers, creative workers and professionals from the creative industry”. What you can see in Barra, with “UNFOLD”, is a market with 100 stands of brands and design products from around the world, with “creative selections and limited artisanal products”, and ticket holders can also visit the special exhibition by designer Florian Lamm. Florian's works were selected for the Top 100 Posters in Germany, Austria and Switzerland, and won the Artist Award at the Brno Biennale, the oldest graphic design exhibition in the world. The “Macau Chill Collective” aims to “bring together the strength of local brands”, inviting “dozens of brands, from well-known cafe owners, creative artisans and creators”. During the festival, the exhibition “Ancient Memories: Impressions of the Shipyard – Historical Photographic Exhibition of the Barra District” will also be held in order to “deepen participants’ understanding of the history of the district”. The “Barra Slow Festival” has free entry and takes place between 12pm and 8pm. It is necessary to purchase tickets for the UNFOLD Art and Design Fair, with a cost of 55 patacas for pre-sale and 78 patacas on the event days. There are also tickets for sale for some events related to coffee culture. Tickets have been on sale since November 2nd on the MacauTicket, Damai and Ctrip platforms. The event is organized by the Federation of Industry and Commerce of Macau, Central and Southern District, co-organized by BANANAFISH and TOPYS, and supported by the Institute of Economic and Technological Development, the Macau Tourism Board, the General Union of Neighborhood Associations of Macau and other sponsoring entities.

item.title: Coloane | “Connections Music.Movement.Nature” this weekend at Urban Farm
item.description: After being postponed due to super typhoon Ragasa, the “Connections – Music.Movement.Nature” festival takes place this weekend in the town of Coloane. Live music, crafts, workshops, dance and various types of activities for families will mark two days of communion at the Urban Farm space “Connections – Music.Movement.Nature” is the result of a community impulse of belonging and sharing of a family bigger than blood and genes, born in the antipodes of a city immersed in materialism and commercialism of the concerts of various types of regional pop that form part of the city's cultural agenda. After two editions in 2018 and 2019, and the postponement due to super typhoon Ragasa, the festival is back this weekend, this time at the Urban Farm space in the town of Coloane. Built by the community, for the community, this year's “Connections” has a lineup filled with 30 workshops from the most varied areas, 20 DJ performances and performances by Beto Ritchie, Lobo and Náv, an area for food, drinks and crafts by local creators and multiple activities for families. “Those responsible, who see themselves as ‘a collective creation that combines a conscious way of life with unique experiences’, intend through this initiative to provide ‘Family Activities, Lectures and Workshops, Exploration of Well-Being and Artistic Expression’”, indicates the organization in a statement. After the events held in 2018 and 2019 in the Ká-Hó Dam area, this year the party moves to a new, larger space, which will allow various activities to take place spread across seven different areas: the “Village”, a picturesque area that resembles a traditional Chinese village, with wooden houses in an oriental garden, will be the area for meals and drinks and the sale of handicrafts. Larry’s Place, Concept H, Lotus Cocktails, Cakes By Rose & Muse, Juk and Happy Stand are responsible for the food and drinks. In the “Village” there will be 10 stands selling crafts from local creators (Dreama, Cordelia Handmade, Zarja’s Selections, CeraGigi, Dollfie, Wickd Candle Studio, White Lodge Dreamland, Love and Light Handmade Studio, Gems Awakening, Free Spirit Home and the Rui Carreiro Barbeiro stand. Inhale, exhale Next door, the “Gypsy Camp”, an area with cushions and resting places, will allow musical exploration with musical instruments such as the asalato, participating in a drum circle, a singing workshop, or attending a handpan concert with the duo Nàv, who curates the area. Nearby, in a Mongolian tent (yurte), there will be a lecture on spiritual themes and individual tarot and soul reading sessions. Activities for families will take place in the “Family Tent”, offering Meditation for Families sessions, Mandala Dot Painting, Crochet, Circles of Life Painting and Construction of Animal Masks on cardboard. In the “family tent” Associação Sílaba will provide moments of interactive reading, the launch of “CaixaPiz” and activities for the little ones. Taking your feet off the ground, the “Treetop” area, a mezzanine built in the top of a tree, was chosen for all body exploration activities and more serene moments of meditation and relaxation. With activities taking place from morning to dusk, the “Treetop” will also host Brazilian Dance and Conscious Dance sessions, as well as Yoga, Gyrokinesis and CoreNature, a fusion of Pilates and Animal Flow. Sound Bath sessions and meditations at sunset and connection to nature are also planned. Enchanted forest At the bottom of the Urban Farm property, in the “Concrete” area, graffiti and urban art sessions are scheduled with the collective of local artists Outloud International Street Art Festival. Finally, in “Woods”, in a clearing in a small forest, there is an open-air electronic music and dance space, which will feature performances by several local and regional DJs. The musical offering will also be present in the “Village” area, with a more organic, lounge selection, focused on world music, as well as a live performance by Beto Ritchie tomorrow at 3pm and Lobo on Sunday at 6pm. Participants are advised to bring warm clothing, insect repellent, hats, sunscreen, towel, flashlight and portable ashtray. The event organizers announced on social media that entrance donations, which are still on sale, cost between 180 and 280 patacas for tickets for one or both days of the event, and at the door they will cost between 200 and 300 patacas.

item.title: Makeup workshop anticipates show at Casa Garden
item.description: On Sunday, starting at 3pm, local makeup artist Mandy Cheuk will teach a workshop at Casa Garden that is an extension of the Surrealist Chinoiserie project: “Golden City of Seres”, which resulted in the presentation of a performance from the Art For All Society (AFA) universe. "As an experienced makeup artist, Mandy Cheuk's expertise encompasses body painting, special effects for film and television, theatrical performances and artistic direction. Her talent is internationally recognized", describes the AFA. The workshop, which has a price of 300 patacas per person, or 500 patacas for two people, is born from the last show “Surrealistic Chinoiserie”—Golden City of Seres”, which was presented in the Belgian city of Antwerp last June. The “made in Macau” performance, which started in Antwerp, will return to Macau on December 6th, at 6:30 pm, at Casa Garden. Entry is free. “Bringing together an elite team of artists from Beijing and Macau, the show weaves a fantastic world through the physical vocabulary of contemporary dance, exclusive artistic makeup, meticulously arranged electronic music and fantasy-filled visual art from Eastern and Western imaginaries”, describes the organization. All elements The visual tension created by the complex perfusion of elements comes to life with choreography inspired by classical and traditional Chinese dances and forms of expression typical of contemporary ballet. The performance is born from the artistic vision of Leong Chi Mou, and is directed and performed by dancers Jay Zheng and Tina Kan, “decorated” by the makeup, body painting and stylistic creation of Mandy Cheuk and the live soundtrack provided by Faye Choi, from the local electronic music band EVADE. The project, which has the “academic support” of Alice Kuok, attempts through various “contemporary perspectives, to deconstruct and remodel the time-honored aesthetic concept, excavating the transformations and extensions of the historic ‘Silk Road’ in the contemporary context and interrogating the latent desires at its core”.

item.title: Exhibition | Creative Macau displays creations between human and machine
item.description: The “Human–Machine Co-Creation” exhibition is on display at Creative Macau until December 27, bringing together works by 18 art and design professors and doctoral students in creative research from the University of Macau. Creative Macau indicates that the creative research carried out by professors and doctoral students in art and design at the University of Macau materializes the collaborative dynamics between human and machine, simultaneously revealing focuses of individuality and spirituality. The entity states that the essence of artistic creativity lies in the ability to reflect current sociocultural and technological contexts, and convey the individuality of the artist. “In the contemporary era characterized by digital media and artificial intelligence, a determining paradigm is the concept of ‘man-machine co-creation’. Artistic production and design practices are increasingly mediated by digital technologies, whose influence extends beyond materiality and technical processes, permeating cognitive structures and aesthetic sensibilities”, contextualizes the organization of the exhibition. The collaborative synergy between human and machine was achieved, according to Creative, in this exhibition. The exhibition consists of creations by Xun Chi, Mengyao Guo, Lampo Leong, Fan Li, Zhenhao Ou, Xipei Ren, Atticus Sims, Ouresis Todorovich, Xiaofeng Wang, Xiaoqian Wang, Yanren Wang, Haozheng Wu, Michael Whittle, Xinxin Xiu, Siyi Xu, Yan Zhang, Yanxiu Zhao and Hongtao Zhou.

item.title: PJ | Request for greater coverage of anti-scam program
item.description: Deputy Chan Lai Kei questioned the Government about the need to reinforce and increase the coverage of the Judiciary Police (PJ) anti-fraud program, taking into account the frequent cases of fraud that occur associated with fake employees of the Taobao platform. Therefore, the deputy, with connections to the Fujian community, questioned whether analyzes using artificial intelligence (AI) could be introduced in this program so that alerts could be given to users whenever they find messages with a high risk of fraud. Furthermore, the deputy recalled that there is a face swap technique using AI, which leads elderly people to easily become victims of fraud, which is why he hopes that the PJ will use this anti-fraud program to publicize these types of cases to groups of potential victims of fraud. In the same question, the deputy also asks how the Government will reinforce cooperation with neighboring regions regarding the sharing of cross-border data, in order to track the origin and flow of capital involved in fraud.

item.title: Real Estate | Quarterly price increase by 7.7 percent
item.description: Data from the Statistics and Census Services Directorate (DSEC) shows that average house prices, per square meter of useful area, increased by 7.7 percent in the third quarter of this year compared to the previous one. In the Macau peninsula alone this increase was 12.6 percent, recording an average price of 74,590 patacas, “mainly due to new housing complexes being put up for sale in the reference quarter”, highlights DSEC. On the islands, the 4 percent increase in Coloane stands out, with the average price of autonomous housing units standing at 87,093 patacas, while in Taipa prices fell 4.6 percent, to around 70,110 patacas. The average price of autonomous housing units in constructed buildings stood at MOP65,897, down 3.2 percent quarter-on-quarter. DSEC also reveals that in the third quarter of this year, based on the stamp tax charged, 1,411 autonomous units and parking spaces were transacted for a value of 6.26 billion patacas. The average price per square meter of useful area of ​​autonomous housing units, in global terms, stood at 74,190 patacas.

item.title: Oceans | China, Portugal and Brazil create research laboratory
item.description: Among the institutions involved in the new project are the University of São Paulo (USP), the University of Macau (UM) and the Instituto Superior Técnico (IST) Academic institutions from China, Portugal and Brazil created a new project in Macau on Friday to collaborate on ocean research, including the impact of climate change and changes in marine currents. “We are going to deepen our knowledge of the oceans and have a more integrated vision, which will allow us to anticipate the future in a safer way”, the coordinator of the Robotics and Engineering Systems Laboratory told Lusa. The objective of the Oceanic Research Center between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries is “to collaborate and share data, resources and talents”, added José Santos-Victor. In addition to the laboratory associated with Instituto Superior Técnico, the new center includes the University of São Paulo (USP), the University of Macau (UM) and the Chinese state laboratory Laoshan Laboratory, based in Qingdao, in eastern China. “There are several research centers that do excellent work in these various areas”, defended Santos-Victor, giving as an example the research and prediction of the effects of climate change on the oceans. According to environmental groups, climate change is one of the greatest threats to the oceans, along with pollution and new technologies that open the door to deep-sea mining and more intensive fishing. A priority will be training, with plans for exchanges between researchers and master's or doctoral students between the center's various laboratories, highlighted the Portuguese academic. New master's degrees During the inauguration ceremony, UM's rector, Song Yonghua, promised the launch of joint master's degree programs between the universities that are part of the initiative. Ettore Apolonio de Barros, professor at USP, reminded Lusa that the Brazilian university created, in 2024, the USP-China Center, to “promote cooperation with Chinese universities”. The researcher highlighted the multidisciplinary nature of the center opened in Macau, as “one of the first initiatives” to bring together scientists and engineers to collaborate in the exploration and study of the oceans. The specialist in automated electromechanical systems recalled that the project is “an important development” of the Oceanic Scientific Research Alliance between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries. The alliance was also created in Macau, in 2022, by 19 universities from China and Portugal, Brazil, Angola and Mozambique, to launch joint research projects on the oceans. The vice-rector of UM, the Portuguese Rui Martins, told Lusa that the alliance was recently strengthened, with the entry of five more institutions, including the University of Hainan, in southern China. On the Portuguese-speaking side, the Technical University of the Atlantic (Cape Verde), the University of Coimbra, the Institute of Systems and Computer Engineering, Technology and Science (INESC TEC) and INESC P&D Brasil joined.

item.title: Royal House | Casino closed on Saturday
item.description: The closure of the Casa Real casino, linked to the concessionaire SJM Resorts, took place on Saturday morning “in accordance with the planned procedures”. The information was revealed by the Gaming Inspection and Coordination Directorate, which coordinated the closure and guaranteed “compliance with legal terms and orderly closure”. "After the closure of the Casa Real Casino, at 11:59 pm on November 21st, the DICJ immediately suspended the operation of the gaming tables, having ensured active coordination with various services, monitoring the process of removal from the respective venue, among others. The closure of the casino took place in an orderly manner", it was communicated. “During the closure of the aforementioned casino, the Directorate of Labor Affairs Services sent staff to the site to provide clarifications to the workers in question, and they were provided with information on an open line for further consultation”, it was added.

item.title: Inflation reaches highest value in the last 14 months
item.description: Annual inflation in Macau accelerated in October, for the fourth consecutive month, reaching 0.6 percent, the highest value in the last 14 months, it was announced on Friday. The rise in the consumer price index (IPC) in October grew by 0.13 percentage points compared to September, and was the highest value since August 2024 (plus 0.74 percent), according to official data. According to the Statistics and Census Services Directorate (DSEC), the acceleration in inflation was mainly due to food products and non-alcoholic drinks (plus 0.7 percent). The cost of meals purchased outside the home rose 1.54 percent. Spending on apartment rent or mortgages rose 0.83 percent and 0.58 percent, respectively. On October 30, the Macau Monetary Authority (AMCM) approved the second interest rate cut in two months. The Legislative Assembly approved, in April 2024, the end of several taxes on the acquisition of housing, to “increase liquidity” in the real estate market, defended the Secretary for Economy and Finance, Lei Wai Nong, at the time. Jewelry going up With the recovery in the number of visitors, the region recorded a 29.8 percent increase in the price of jewelry, goldsmithing and watches, popular products among tourists from mainland China. The cost of tours and hotels for Macau residents' overseas trips increased by 5.87 percent, while expenditure on education and vehicle fuel rose by 1.67 percent and 3.18 percent, respectively. Inflation in Macau accelerated in October, in a period in which the CPI rose again and fell in mainland China, after four months of decline. In mainland China, by far Macau's largest trading partner, the CPI registered a year-on-year increase of 0.2 percent. China recorded deflation in six of the ten months this year. Deflation reflects weakness in domestic consumption and investment and is particularly serious, as a fall in the price of assets, normally contracted using credit, generates an imbalance between the value of loans and bank guarantees. The value recorded in September surprised analysts, who predicted that the indicator would remain unchanged compared to October 2024.

item.title: Tourism | New visitor record for October
item.description: The territory received around 33.1 million visitors in the first ten months, 14.1 percent more than in the same period last year. It is the second highest value ever, below pre-pandemic records Macau received 3.47 million visitors in October, 10.8 percent more than in the same period in 2024 and the highest figure ever for this month, it was announced. The number of tourists passing through the territory was the highest for any month of October since the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) began compiling monthly data, in 1998, still during the Portuguese administration. The region had already registered a historic high for September in the previous month: almost 3.8 million visitors, 9.8 percent more than in the same period in 2024. However, in October almost 61 percent of visitors (2.1 million) arrived on organized tours and spent less than a day in Macau. In 2024, the Central Government announced a series of measures to support the territory, such as increasing the tax exemption limit for goods for personal use purchased by visitors from China. At the same time, the Chinese authorities expanded the list of places with “individual visas” to visit Hong Kong and Macau to 10 more cities in China. Additionally, since January 1, residents of the neighboring city of Zhuhai can visit Macau once a week and stay for up to seven days. As a result, the overwhelming majority (89.8 percent) of tourists arriving in Macau in September came from mainland China or Hong Kong, while just over 353,000 were international visitors. The city received a total of around 33.1 million visitors in the first ten months, 14.1 percent more than in the same period in 2024 and the second highest figure ever for the start of a year. Below 2019 According to official data, the number of tourists passing through Macau was only surpassed between January and October 2019 – before the Covid-19 pandemic -, a period in which it registered more than 33.4 million visitors. On January 17, the director of Macau Tourism Services said she expected between 38 and 39 million visitors this year. In August, Maria Helena de Senna Fernandes set a target of more than three million international visitors in 2025. In the first ten months of the year, Macau received almost 2.97 million tourists from abroad, 14.9 percent more than in the same period in 2024. Citizens of Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain and Oman will no longer need a visa to enter the city from July 16th. Despite the increase in the number of tourists, the average consumption of each visitor in Macau, excluding casinos, fell by 9.5 percent in the first nine months of the year, compared to the same period in 2024. At the beginning of May, DSEC pointed to the “change in the consumption pattern of visitors” as one of the main reasons for the 1.3 percent drop in Macau's economy between January and March. It was the first time that the territory's Gross Domestic Product shrank, in year-on-year terms, since the end of 2022, when the region began to lift restrictions due to the covid-19 pandemic. Macau received 34.9 million visitors last year, 23.8 percent more than the previous year, but still far from the record, 39.4 million, set in 2019, before the pandemic.

item.title: PLP and China want international arbitration platform
item.description: The Federation of Portuguese-Speaking Lawyers signed a protocol in the special economic zone of Hengqin, neighboring Macau, for cooperation in arbitration between China and the Portuguese-speaking world, the president of the institution told Lusa yesterday. “In Portugal, conflicts in the courts drag on for several years and, obviously, we know that arbitration is an expeditious means of obtaining justice and, therefore, it is so convenient to have arbitration in operation, arbitration in the Portuguese language, in which the parties can, in essence, resolve their disputes in the language that unites us”, explained Pedro Pais de Almeida. The official, who is in Macau to participate in the FALP Congress, noted that the agreement was signed on Wednesday with the Macau Bar Association, “several bar associations” from Portuguese-speaking countries and the executive committee for the Management of the Deep Cooperation Zone between Guangdong and Macau, in Hengqin. The Deep Cooperation Zone is a special economic area, covering approximately 106 square kilometers, created in 2021 with a view to economic diversification and regional integration of Macau with the rest of the country. According to the protocol, which Pedro Pais de Almeida provided to Lusa, the initiative, the Center for Economic and Commercial Services between China and Portuguese/Spanish Speaking Countries (CECPS) – created by the Government of Macau and the executive committee of the Deep Cooperation Zone – aims to “promote cooperation in cross-border arbitration between China and Portuguese-speaking countries”. “In response to the urgent need of companies to resolve cross-border commercial and investment disputes, CECPS plans to mobilize human and material resources, in collaboration with sectoral partners from Portuguese and Spanish-speaking countries, with a view to establishing an international arbitration platform that is intended to serve economic, commercial and investment cooperation between China and the respective countries”, the document reads. All open To promote the creation of the platform, it is proposed, among other initiatives, to study how to “integrate the particularities of legal regimes, commercial practices and arbitration and mediation procedures” in China and Portuguese-speaking countries, in addition to establishing a platform for regular dialogue to deepen professional cooperation in the fields of arbitration and mediation. It is also noted that the initiative remains “open to future participation”, with, for example, associations or law firms, arbitrators, experts and academics being able to participate on a voluntary basis. On Wednesday, the chief executive of Macau, Sam Hou Fai, said that the CECPS has been providing “legal and accounting” services to foreign companies since “the beginning of this year”. China established the Macau Special Administrative Region (SAR) as a platform for strengthening economic and trade cooperation with Portuguese-speaking countries in 2003. More than two decades later, Macau is expanding its focus to Spanish-speaking countries. A cooperação deve incidir, como indicou o Governo na apresentação geral das Linhas de Acção Governativa para 2025, entre outros sectores, nas áreas das finanças, cultura, turismo e comércio eletrónico transfronteiriço. The FALP congress began on Wednesday, with a visit to Hengqin, and ends today, with a gala dinner and a tribute to two lawyers who have practiced in Macau for several decades, Jorge Neto Valente and Rui Cunha.

item.title: ZELENSKY VS ZELENSKY
item.description:
10/27/22 A Ukrainian pensioner, with the same name as the president, blames Zelensky for the prolongation of the conflict that destroyed his village. Zelensky, the villager, who never left his land, is now mortified because his favorite gravedigger died in the bomber. This Zelensky, a villager, represents half the world that recriminates the other Zelensky, the villain, for not wanting to negotiate with Putin. Negotiate what? The invader enters our house, covers his wife and daughter (cf. recent UN report on the rapes in Ukraine, in this “special operation”), an act that forced us to watch, and then we say to him: hi there, we are for peace, but we have to negotiate: you still haven't said what name you want to give the children! A peace that is not dignified is nothing more than a cessation of rights. As serious as the Russophobia that Putin inflicts on his people.
10/28/22 Num almoço com vários convivas ouço uma amiga, que se declara espírita, a explanar sobre as particularidades da sua crença, de uma forma serena e equilibrada, diria até, sem ponta de “irracionalismo”. He spoke at length and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytism. “Here is someone whose belief has brought thoughtfulness!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at a certain moment a sentence comes out that horrifies me. It says, “there is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, and I glimpse the voracious maws of holism. Because holism has a pathological aspect, like all good things, a shadow side. Two examples: in Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is just an expression of rigorous karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts he committed in his previous life. In Africa, it is not accepted that death could have been accidental, and many women are accused by the family of the deceased of having caused the death of their husband, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, a huge injustice for the wife — madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism introduced Compassion and Christianity introduced Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a Platonic stage, where we are nothing more than the shadows of something — an inextricable law -, in a determinism that calcifies all singularities, but that strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity was anchored in the conquest of chance and randomness, removing the incidences of a life from this fierce determinism that enclosed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at that moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and its volition were able to emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “there is no such thing as chance, nothing happens by chance!”, which should function as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, however, this phrase is usually used to seek a reason for things outside of us, in others. It's an alibi. Today there is a holistic temptation in the world, just as there was a satanic temptation in the Middle Ages, without much reflection on its consequences. Because it's not enough to want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even for the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to that cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the fight” took place at the beginning of this century. One of the great mistakes of the 20th century was the false dichotomy between “rationalism and irrationalism”, a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality (the positive side of reason) was confused with rationalism (the pathological aspect of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment, irrationalism was confused with freedom. Almost all 20th century art, with Surrealism at its head, made this mistake. The fallacy still exists despite the emergence of “irrationalism” and the consequent relativist currents that followed it having been consolidated everywhere. Essentially, much of what happened in the 20th century revolved around this clash between two paradigms: Rationalism versus Irationalism. Now, I see, we must save indeterminacy, chance, randomness from the terrible temptation of the cage of causalities. Holism, in its pathological form, may be reductionism that sets itself up as a new “eschatological narrative”. Is it “by chance” that holism emerges at a time when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person is besieging everything, all freedoms, all acquired rights?
